Title: The Day the Earth Stood Still
PlotSummary: When a flying saucer lands in Washington, D.C., the Army quickly surrounds it. A humanoid (Michael Rennie) emerges, announcing that he has come in peace. When he unexpectedly opens a small device, he is shot by a nervous soldier. A tall robot emerges from the saucer and quickly disintegrates the soldiers' weapons. Klaatu escapes and lodges at a boarding house as "Mr. Carpenter"

Title: The Burning
PlotSummary: One night at Camp Blackfoot, several campers pull a prank on the caretaker named Cropsy by setting a worm-riddled skull next to his bed with candles in the eye sockets. Five years later, Cropsy is released from the hospital despite having to deal with failed skin grafts, and wears a coat and hat to hide his deformities. While outside, a prostitute lures him, and in a fit of rage, he repeatedly stabs her with a pair of scissors. The next morning, a camper named Alfred scares Sally as she steps out of the shower, and campers Karen and Eddy

Title: Nobel Chor
PlotSummary: Rabindranath Tagore's Nobel medal was stolen from Shantiniketan in Bengal, where it was housed in his residence turned museum. A nationwide furor started and a massive search operation was put in place to find the guilty. Ultimately the medal was not found and the Central Bureau of Investigations (CBI) dropped the case in 2010.

Title: Trent's Last Case
PlotSummary: Phillip Trent becomes convinced that Sigsbee Manderson's death was murder. Coroner concludes that Manderson had killed himself at the inquest. However, Trent is given permission by his editor to pursue the story. His attention is drawn to the widow of the deceased, Margaret Manderson.

Title: Aafat
PlotSummary: Inspector Amar and Inspector Chhaya are after the criminal Hardayal. Amar goes beyond the call of duty and becomes suspended. Amar is caught by the criminal and is held captive. Chhayal is supposed to find the criminal. Amar and Chhayan fall in love.

Title: Zardoz
PlotSummary: In a future post-apocalyptic Earth in the year 2293, the human population is divided into the immortal "Eternals" and mortal "Brutals" The Eternals are overseen and protected from death by the Tabernacle, an artificial intelligence. The Vortex developed complex social rules whose violators are punished with artificial aging. The most extreme offenders are condemned to permanent old age.

Title: I Cover Big Town
PlotSummary: "Illustrated Press" society editor Lorelei Kilbourne (Hillary Brooke) is assigned to a police case. Her crusading newspaper editor Steve Kilgore suspects that hard-luck suspect Harry Hilton (Frank Wilcox) has been framed on a murder rap. The film also uncovers a conspiracy to bring a building firm to bankruptcy.

Title: Sultan
PlotSummary: Sivan (Vinu Mohan) is a medical college student better known in the campus as 'Sultan' He and his four childhood close friends Naufal(Anoop Chandran),Sunny (Praveenkrishna),Vivek (Sreejithravi) forms a gang in the college. Sivan is in love with Nishitha (Varada), who is also a student in the same college.

Title: A Good Year
PlotSummary: Max Skinner is an unethical yet very successful hard-working London-based bond trader with a sense of humour. He travels to Provence to prepare a quick sale of his uncle's vineyard estate in south-eastern France. Max becomes enamoured with the beautiful, feisty café owner Fanny Chenal, who is rumoured to have sworn off men.

Title: Face
PlotSummary: Ray, Dave, Stevie, Julian and Jason plan a heist to steal a minimum of £2 million. However, they only get the amount of money they wanted, and only £68,000 to each man. The group, without Julian, later spend time at a bar with fellow criminal Sonny, and Ray's girlfriend Connie, a protestor. The four are alerted to a pair of undercover police officers and flee, Dave and Julian engaging in a shootout with the police.

Title: The Slipper and the Rose
PlotSummary: Prince Edward of Euphrania refuses to marry Selena of Carolsveld, whom his parents have arranged for him to marry. Cinderella's cruel stepmother has banished her to the cellar, and forces her to work as a servant to her and her two vindictive daughters, Isobella and Palatine. Edward's parents want a political alliance with one of the neighboring kingdoms to protect them against war and to secure their safety and future existence.

Title: After Tonight
PlotSummary: Rudolph "Rudy" Ritter is a captain in the Austrian Ministry of War assigned to deal with Russian spies, particularly the successful K-14. He gets a lead when a secret message is intercepted; it contains information about a newly improved flamethrower. Rudy sees Karen every night, and the pair fall in love.

Title: Eyecatch Junction
PlotSummary: The Shintai Sobu fitness club is formed by the chief of police to maintain high public opinion of the police force. Its first recruit is the ambitious traffic cop Makoto. Together with their fitness instructor Miyuki these daring policewomen form the secret Eyecatch Junction team to defeat criminals using athletics and gymnastics. Megumi Okada, contractor for the Central Station's Crime Lab and the mayor's daughter, eavesdrops on their conversations using her technology and secretly sends them information she collects under the code name.

Title: The King
PlotSummary: The city of Kozhikode is victimized by a massive communal riot against the slums, costing the lives of 12 people. The aggressive and belligerent, yet honorable and incorruptible district collector Joseph Alex IAS (Mammootty) is suspicious of Shankar's activities and decides to investigate the case.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
PlotSummary: A spy discovers that the Chinese government has created a doomsday device (the "key" to which, "only Chairman Mao has") capable of destroying the Earth. Half of the male flight crew are replaced by women shortly before take-off, including one Russian. After leaving Earth, the crew deduce that they have been put together to restart the human race should the Chinese activate their device. Shortly after this, the device goes off and Earth is destroyed.

Title: Destination Meatball
PlotSummary: A line of people (including Woody) drool at the window of the shop of market butcher Buzz Buzzard. A series of gags ensues about how Buzz dishonestly (and literally) "jacks" up all his prices. Since Woody is broke as usual, he sneaks in and gets thrown out by Buzz. On the way out, Woody collides with a bottle of invisible ink and turns partially invisible.

Title: Devil's Knot
PlotSummary: In 1993, three eight-year-old boys from West Memphis, Arkansas, go missing from their neighborhood. Their bound and beaten bodies are found the next day. The community and the police department are convinced that the murders are the work of a satanic cult. A month later, three teenagers – Damien Echols, Jason Baldwin, and Jessie Misskelley Jr. – are arrested and sentenced to life in prison.

Title: Darna Zaroori Hai
PlotSummary: Darna Zaroori Hai interweaves six stories into one film. Five children get lost in the middle of a forest until they find a haunted house. The children decide to have a competition to see who gets scared first. One child goes down to the bathroom, only to come back as a ghost without revealing her real identity.

Title: Star of Midnight
PlotSummary: Clay "Dal" Dalzell (William Powell) is asked by old friend Tim Winthrop (Leslie Fenton) to locate his girlfriend Alice, who mysteriously disappeared in Chicago a year ago. Winthrop cannot stop thinking about her and believes she is in New York. Gossip columnist Tommy Tennant (Russell Hopton) claims to have discovered a vital clue to the mystery.

Title: Mother Lode
PlotSummary: George Spalding disappears after a flight into northern British Columbia's interior wilderness to search for gold. Jean Dupre is available for hire after intimidating a surly passenger with aerobatics in a Molyco Company Cessna 206. The search turns into a whodunit mystery/adventure, involving mistaken identities, greed and murder.

Title: The Final Destination
PlotSummary: Nick O'Bannon has a premonition of a horrible car accident that sends debris into the stands, causing the stadium to collapse. The group visits the mechanic shop to warn Andy, but he is killed when a CO2 tank launches him through a chain link fence. Janet is crushed under the tires, Lori is decapitated by the impact, and Nick is propelled into a wall, dislocating his jaw.

Title: Gangway
PlotSummary: Film critic Pat Wayne boards an ocean liner to New York to interview glamorous movie star Nedda Beaumont. Pat somehow gets mixed up with a gangster and a Scotland yard inspector. Both mistake her for a female jewel thief called "Sparkle" The film critic is sent to interview a movie star in New York.

Title: Siliconn City
PlotSummary: The film begins with Sanjay (Srinagar Kitty) along with his friend locking up an unknown man and torturing him with a camera filming the whole incident. The movie then turns to a flash back, where Sanjay narrates how happy he and his family was. Sanjay's middle-class family life also has his friend (Chikkanna) mingling as one of the family member. The delay in getting his bike and seeing his classmate James (Girish) spending casually makes him curious to know what he does for money.

Title: The Precipice Game
PlotSummary: Liu Chenchen, a free-spirited young woman, rebels against her wealthy family and elopes with her boyfriend to join a cruise-bond treasure hunt. But what began as an innocent game with promises of great reward soon turns into a battle for survival. Liu relies only on her wits and her new friends to survive, all the while unmasking foes.

Title: Mirza - The untold Story
PlotSummary: Mirza: The Untold Story is based on the legendary love story of Mirza and Sahiba. Mirza (Gippy Grewal) and his Sahiba (Mandy Takhar) fall in love with each other at a very young age. The story takes a turn as Mirza meets Sahiba and their love flourishes once again.

Title: Love Camp 7
PlotSummary: The movie follows two female American officers (played by Maria Lease and Kathy Williams) who volunteer to enter a Nazi camp undercover to gain information from, and possibly rescue, an inmate. The camp's female inmates serve as prostitutes for German officers and are subjected to humiliating treatment, torture, and rape.

Title: Our Very Own
PlotSummary: Los Angeles teenager Gail Macaulay is going steady with deliveryman Chuck, a relationship that sparks jeaolusy in her younger sister Joan. Joan discovers Gail's adoption papers at her sister's 18th birthday party. Gail persuades Lois to have their lawyer arrange a meeting with her birth mother, Gert Lynch, but Lois decides to visit Gert in her Long Beach home first. Gert is thrilled to see photographs of Gail but is loath to let her second husband Jim know she has a child. Lois arranges a meeting the following evening, when Jim will be out.

Title: Mama's Affair
PlotSummary: Eve's mother goes into hysterics at the thought of losing her daughter. Eve's eyes are opened and she uses a "treat 'em rough" theory to cure her mother of her hysterics. Eve is willing to marry her mother's son Henry, an effeminate youngster with rimmed glasses.

Title: Angels with Dirty Faces
PlotSummary: In 1923, two youths, Rocky Sullivan (Frankie Burke) and Jerry Connolly (William Tracy) attempt to rob a railroad car carrying fountain pens. After serving his sentence, Rocky returns to his old neighborhood and visits Jerry (Pat O'Brien), who is now a Catholic priest. Rocky rents a room in a boarding house run by Laury Martin, a girl he bullied in school.

Title: The Nun and the Bandit
PlotSummary: In the 1940s, two outlaw brothers kidnap their 14-year-old second cousin. Things get complicated when a nun refuses to abandon her charge. The nuns are chaperoning the girl, who is chaperoned by the kidnappers. The film is set in New York City, New York.

Title: Kalidasu
PlotSummary: Kalidasu (Sushanth) is the son of a sincere police officer (Nagabababu), who is killed in the hands of a factionist (GV) However, he kills that factionist and escapes from Rayalaseema and reaches Guntur. Kanakadurga (Jayasudha) brings him up along with her son Jai Dev (Vamsikrishna) by turning himself a car-lifter. The girl says that her name is Mirchi (Tamannaah) and pretends that she is a lunatic.

Title: Everybody Does It
PlotSummary: Leonard Borland (Paul Douglas) lives and works in New York City as a wrecking contractor, married to socialite Doris (Celeste Holm) Doris considers herself an aspiring opera singer and regularly pressures Leonard to accompany her to operas. Doris is too busy training with her mother and vocal coach to note what her husband is up to, and believes he is on the road for his wrecking work. While on tour, Cecil attempts to seduce him, but Leonard rejects her.

Title: The Family Secret
PlotSummary: David Clark kills best friend Art Bradley in self-defense after an argument. He flees, but later confesses to his father, Howard, a lawyer. Howard Clark proves a key eyewitness to be a convicted perjurer. David finally realizes he must turn himself in and promises to lead a better life.

Title: The Vengeance of She
PlotSummary: A beautiful young European girl, Carol, is drawn through mental telepathy to the ancient lost city of Kuma, there to become the reincarnation of its lost former ruler, Ayesha, and consort of her predecessor's lover, Kallikrates. In return, Men-Hari, a member of the Magi, the ancient Chaldean race of wise men, will also be allowed to enter the sacred flame and become immortal, which will expand his already formidable mental powers to the point where he will be able to take over the entire world. In the course of their travels, Carol and Phillip are

Title: After Hours
PlotSummary: Paul Hackett, a computer word processor, meets Marcy Franklin in a cafe in New York City. On his way to visit Marcy, his $20 bill is blown out the window of the cab, leaving him with only some spare pocket change. Paul then attempts to go home by subway, but the fare has increased at the stroke of midnight, and he finds that his pocket change is no longer sufficient to purchase a token. Afterward, Paul spots two actual burglars, Neil (Cheech Marin) and Pepe (Tommy Chong) with one of Kiki's sculptures, they flee, dropping the sculpture in

Title: Takkar
PlotSummary: Chaitali Choudhury marries nephew oriented man Ajoy (Prosenjit) against the wishes of her elder brother and aunt. But within a couple of months she and Ajoy go loggerheads over the issue of Ajoy's beloved nephew Arun (Rishi) Arun grows up to become a spoilt brat. The estranged couple still love each other but they can never unite again due to social constraints.

Title: Five Gates to Hell
PlotSummary: Several nurses are taken captive in Indochina by a band of marauders led by Chen Pamok. Chen becomes infatuated with Athena Roberts and, after she resists, she is raped. Athena uses her wiles to lead a revolt, mowing down guerrillas with machine guns.

Title: Night of the Living Dead 3D
PlotSummary: Barb and her brother Johnny arrive late for their aunt's funeral and find the cemetery overrun with zombies. Barb flees the cemetery and is rescued by Ben, a local college student. The two seek refuge in the nearby farmhouse of the Cooper family (Henry & Hellie Cooper, Henry's daughter and Hellie's stepdaughter Karen, farmhand Owen, and farmhand Tom and his girlfriend Judy.

Title: Waking the Dead
PlotSummary: The film flashes back and forth between the 1970s and 1980s and centers on the relationship between Fielding Pierce, a young Coast Guard officer with political ambitions, and idealistic Roman Catholic Sarah Williams. In the opening scene, Fielding sees a television news program reporting Sarah's death in a Minneapolis car bombing following a church-organized excursion to Chile to feed the poor and organize resistance to the oppressive Pinochet dictatorship.

Title: Who Killed Who?
PlotSummary: A live-action host (Robert Emmett O'Connor) opens with a disclaimer about the nature of the cartoon. The story begins on a dark and stormy night as the victim (voiced by Kent Rogers) is reading a book based on the cartoon he's in. Frightened, he muses that, according to the book, he is about to be "bumped off" A mysterious killer in a heavy black cloak and hood shoots him dead with a rather large pistol.

Title: Vampire in Brooklyn
PlotSummary: An abandoned ship crashes into a dockyard in Brooklyn, New York, and the ship inspector, Silas Green, inspects it, finding it full of corpses. Max, a mysterious vampire, kills Julius and infects Julius with his vampiric blood, turning Julius into a decaying ghoul. Max is sent to her by her father (a vampire, making Rita a dhamphir), whom she has long been curious about.

Title: Something Short of Paradise
PlotSummary: Madeleine Ross (Susan Sarandon) is a journalist, and her boyfriend, Harris Sloane (David Steinberg), is the owner of an art theatre. Their relationship is on-again/off-again, and when Madeeine meets the French star Jean-Fidel Mileau (Jean-Pierre Aumont) it provokes changes in the way she and Harris feel.

Title: Crooklyn
PlotSummary: In 1973, nine-year-old Troy Carmichael and her brothers Clinton, Wendell, Nate, and Joseph live in the Bedford-Stuyvesant neighborhood of Brooklyn. The children live with their parents, Woody, a struggling musician, and Carolyn, a schoolteacher. Troy assumes the matriarch role that Carolyn left behind.

Title: Pumpkinhead II: Blood Wings
PlotSummary: In 1958 in Ferren Woods, a small backwater town, an old blind witch, Ms. Osie, feeds a deformed orphan named Tommy; he is the offspring of Pumpkinhead. As Tommy eats, a car of six teens chases him with switchblade knives and baseball bats; they corner him at an old iron mine, killing him. Thirty-five years later, Sheriff Sean Braddock, his wife, and his daughter Jenny have come into town.

Title: Road to Paradise
PlotSummary: Loretta Young plays the part of an orphan who has been raised by two thieves (Raymond Hatton and George Barraud) and does not know that she has a twin sister. One day, while she is dining at a Chinese restaurant with her two guardians, they notice the wealthy socialite and are taken aback at how closely she resembles Young. Young tricks the police into thinking that Waring is an imposter and thief. The charges against Waring are dropped and Young accepts Mulhall's proposal of marriage.

Title: Cold Light of Day
PlotSummary: Will Shaw (Henry Cavill) owns a consultancy business in San Francisco about to go into insolvency, reluctantly visiting his family in Spain for a holiday. Will's preoccupation with the phone results in a sailing accident where Will leaps to save his brother's girlfriend Dara (Emma Hamilton) from being hit by the yacht's boom but she hits her head on a winch. Will swims to town to fetch medical supplies and to cool down; when he returns, he can no longer find his family. Martin reveals he is a CIA agent, and that the kidnappers are after a briefcase he had

Title: Billy Elliot
PlotSummary: Billy Elliot, 11, loves to dance and has hopes of becoming a professional ballet dancer. His widowed father and older brother are outraged at the prospect of him becoming a dancer. Jackie and Tony are outraged that Billy will be considered to be gay. Over Christmas, Billy learns his best friend Michael is gay, but is supportive of his friend.

Title: Chandni
PlotSummary: Rohit (Rishi Kapoor) meets Chandni (Sridevi) at a wedding of a relative and falls instantly in love with her. Eventually, they are engaged to be married soon. Rohit's family is against this marriage decision because of the difference in their social status, but that does not bother Rohit.

Title: Seven Footprints to Satan
PlotSummary: Jim and Eve are kidnapped on the eve of Jim's departure for Africa. They are brought to a mansion that is home to a strange and glamorous Satanic cult. A young society couple are kidnapped and brought to the mansion by a cult. The film is set in New York City, New York.

Title: Opium and the Kung-Fu Master
PlotSummary: Master Tie Qiao San (Ti Lung) is the leader of the Ten Tigers of Canton. At that time, the opium ban was in use, but public sale of opium was widely available. Many bureaucrats were taking opium, as Tie followed a trend that led to his physical skills declining. Seeing how Tie's skills are declining, opium store owner Rong Feng challenges Tie to a public duel. Tie struggles to fight Rong and was in serious danger until his disciple Lu Guasi steps in to rescue him.

Title: Angst
PlotSummary: Angst tells the story of a group of horror film devotees living in Sydney's King's Cross. It has been described as an Australian version of Kevin Smith's Clerks and Mallrats with the same Dark humor as SubUrbia. The film stars Sam Lewis as a cynical, sexually frustrated video store employee with a bad case of unresolved love.

Title: Foolproof
PlotSummary: Kevin (played by Reynolds), Sam (Booth) and Rob (Jarsky) create working plans to infiltrate and burgle various targets. They do not actually execute these heists, preferring to simply simulate them. All is fine until a famous criminal, Leo Gillete (Suchet) steals the trio's plans for a jewelry warehouse heist and accomplishes it. He then blackmails the group into designing and executing a plan to steal $20 million in bonds from a bank.

Title: Old Dogs
PlotSummary: Dan Rayburn (Robin Williams) and Charlie Reed (John Travolta) are best friends and co-owners of a successful sports marketing firm. Seven years prior, Dan, recently divorced, married Vicki (Kelly Preston) after being whisked away by Charlie for a tropical vacation. Vicki resurfaces to tell Dan that their short marriage resulted in twins Zach (Conner Rayburn) and Emily.

Title: The President
PlotSummary: A revolution is happening in a country with a dictatorial president. The president sends his family abroad but his grandson wants to stay with his grandfather. In order to save their lives they run away and the president disguises himself as a gypsy. They must experience poverty and hunger during their journey, and see the effects of the dictatorship.

Title: Love Is Love
PlotSummary: Shi Jinshui and Wu Daidi were childhood sweethearts. They elope from their hometown and live in urban areas. Shi falls in love with his superior and break up with his wife. Two years later he finds himself still in love and decides to find his beloved wife.

Title: Phillauri
PlotSummary: A young man returns to India from Canada to marry his long-term girlfriend Anu (Mehreen Pirzada), but comes to know that as he is a manglik (born under an unlucky star) he has to get married to a tree before getting married to her. As a result, from that day onwards he is haunted by the spirit of a woman named Shashi (Anushka Sharma), who lived in that particular tree and hence claims to now be'married' to him. The story of Phillauri and Shashi is slowly revealed via the latter's flashbacks.

Title: Jakkanna
PlotSummary: A man's attempts to repay a kindness earns him the wrath of a ruthless gangster (Kabir Duhan Singh) who just wants to be left alone to continue his illegal dealings. The film is based on a novel written by Sunil Singh in India.

Title: Pained
PlotSummary: Street vendor Dong-hyun (Jung Ryeo-won) suffers from severe hemophilia, a disorder that impedes the body's ability to stop bleeding. Nam-soon (Kwon Sang-woo) lost his sense of pain after a traumatic accident during his youth.

Title: My Ordinary Love Story
PlotSummary: Eun-jin struggles to make her seventh relationship work after six failed ones. She begins to suspect that her new boyfriend, bumbling but sweet Hyun-suk, may be hiding something from her. Hyun Suk is a bumbling, but sweet bumbling and bumbling Korean.

Title: Uneasy Terms
PlotSummary: Slim Callaghan is a private eye whose client, Colonel Stenhurst, is murdered. Viola, the eldest of the Colonel's three stepdaughters, is the prime suspect. After wading through clues and romance, Callaghan corners the real culprit.[3]

Title: Pugaippadam
PlotSummary: Krishna and Gowri were friends in their college since I-year. Shiney George(Priya Anand) joined in their gang and soon Shiney and Krishna Fell in Love. Bala admired at shiney at first sight and loved her when she supported him at the time of Ragging. But the plan went wrong when shiney slapped Krishna and the gang broken up.

Title: Hotel Chelsea
PlotSummary: A newlywed Japanese couple travel to the Hotel Chelsea in New York City to enjoy their honeymoon. One night, the wife finds the lifeless body of her husband and a video of the brutal murder. A police detective arrives at the scene and tries to reconstruct the events surrounding the mysterious crime.

Title: Anjathe
PlotSummary: Sathyavan (Narain) and Kirubakaran (Ajmal Ameer) are close friends living opposite each other in the police quarters neighborhood. Parallel is the story of Deena Dayalan (Prasanna) and Loganathan aka Logu (Pandiarajan) who extort money from businessmen through kidnappings. Sathya gains fame by holding off knife-wielding men who come to kill an injured man at a hospital, though the man is killed later in the night. Kiruba is employed by Daya, mainly because the former is distraught and will fall easily to the lure of money

Title: London After Midnight
PlotSummary: Sir Roger Balfour's death is officially declared a suicide by Inspector Edward C. Burke of Scotland Yard. Five years later, with the case still unresolved, a sinister-looking man with pointed teeth wearing a Beaver-skin top hat, arrives at the household with a cadaverous-looking woman in a long gown. The arrival of these two individuals prompts the arrival of Sir James Hamlin, the friend and neighbour of the deceased, to call Scotland Yard to investigate.

Title: River's Edge
PlotSummary: In Northern California, an adolescent boy, Tim (Joshua John Miller), throws a doll into a river. On the opposite bank, he sees teenager John "Samson" Tollet (Daniel Roebuck) smoking a cigarette; next to him is the nude corpse of his girlfriend, Jamie (Danyi Deats) Next to him, Tim encounters John arguing with the clerk over buying beer. Tim and his friend Moko break into Feck's house in search of a gun, but find his stash of marijuana instead. Samson drunkenly begins to brag about killing Jamie, recounting his strangling her to death

Title: The Vagabond King
PlotSummary: Jeanette MacDonald is Katherine, the high-born girl whom Villon pines for. Huguette, a tavern wench (Lillian Roth) gives up her life to save her beloved poet. Despite being successful against the Burgundians, Villon is sentenced to hang by King Louis XI.

Title: Mallikarjuna
PlotSummary: Ravichandran plays a dual role of Father - son. Seetha pairs up for the father role, Sadha pairs for the son role. Sadha plays the son in the role of a father-to-be-son role in the film. Ravich and Sadha play the roles of the father and son.

Title: Immortal Sergeant
PlotSummary: In North Africa, experienced Sergeant Kelly (Thomas Mitchell) leads out a British patrol, accompanied by Corporal Colin Spence (Henry Fonda), an unassertive Canadian. Spence has to assert his leadership when one of his men advocates surrendering, leading them in a surprise attack under the cover of a sandstorm. Kelly orders Spence to leave him behind; when Spence refuses to obey, he shoots himself.

Title: The Pied Piper of Hamelin
PlotSummary: The Pied Piper (Van Johnson) is first spotted working magic in Hamelin by a disabled boy, Paul, and playing his signature tune In the Hall of the Mountain King. The town of Hamelin has entered a competition in order to win a banner from the King. It is then that the Piper magically appears before the Mayor and his councilors. Asking to be paid all the money in the town's treasury, he offers to rid the town of the rats. The Piper rids the rats, but the Mayor plots to use the gold to construct the chimes.

Title: Kalyug
PlotSummary: This is a tale of intrigue, plots and the inevitable war between two families. Ramchand and Bhishamchand were two pioneering brothers in business. A series of events brings the feud between the two families to light. The situation gets out of hand and events take a tragic turn.

Title: One from the Heart
PlotSummary: Hank, a mechanic, and Frannie, a travel agent, break up while celebrating their fifth anniversary. After their nights of passion, Hank breaks down, tracks Frannie to her lover's apartment and abducts her. She refuses to stay with him and walks away, saying that this time it is goodbye forever.

Title: The World's Greatest Lover
PlotSummary: Rudy Hickman is a neurotic baker from Milwaukee, but aspires to become a Hollywood star. His entry into the contest tests his marriage, and his neuroses manifest in his screen test, where he nearly kills his fellow actress. Now calling himself "Rudy Valentine," he gets a slot in the final phase of the contest just after finding his wife Annie has left him.

Title: Open Tee Bioscope
PlotSummary: The film steers through comedy, drama, and emotions of the middle class community of 1990's Kolkata. The film carefully captures the essence of North K.Kolkata, and the quintessential spirit of the para football. It is based on a documentary based on the book, "The World Cup", which was released in November 2013.

Title: Watchers
PlotSummary: A mutated monster known as the OXCOM (Outside Experimental Combat Mammal) escapes and chases a golden retriever from the same lab, through the surrounding woods. Travis Cornell (Corey Haim) is with his girlfriend Tracey (Lala Sloatman) in the barn. Travis starts to realize the dog is extraordinary and decides to keep it. Meanwhile, an NSO agent named Johnson (Michael Ironside) is dispatched by the corporation to retrieve the animals. The next morning, Travis's mother informs him that Tracey is in the hospital.

Title: Başka Dilde Aşk
PlotSummary: Onur, who has been deaf since birth, works as a librarian. His father had left him and his mother when he was seven, and Onur has always blamed himself for this. Zeynep is forced by her overbearing father to leave home and gets a job at a call-center. She finds peace with Onur who she communicates with perfectly without speaking.

Title: Fantasia
PlotSummary: In 1969 of Hong Kong, private detective agency director Man (Sean Lau) and his two employees, Sam (Louis Koo) and Fugu (Jordan Chan) are investigating an adultery case. In the pile of debris, Fugu finds a lamp which was unable to turn on, where Man throws the lamp out the window. A sorceress named Harmy Bobo magically emerges from the lamp and asks the trio to each make a wish, so she can return to her world. Bobo's failed spells causes Man to be exposed from his cheating, and thus, he forges a rivalry with gang boss Kin.

Title: Diary of a Wimpy Kid
PlotSummary: Greg attends his first day at middle school and discovers the ups and downs, such as the missing stall doors in the boys' bathroom and the difficulties of obtaining a seat during lunch break. Greg and his best friend Rowley learn about the Cheese Touch - a rotten piece of cheese on the basketball court that makes anyone who touches it an outcast. The boys join Safety Patrol in an effort to become popular, and they try out for a contest that offers a student a chance to become the new cartoonist for the school paper. After Greg breaks Rowley's arm during a game the boys played, Rowley becomes extremely popular,

Title: The Joy Luck Club
PlotSummary: The Joy Luck Club was formed by four women in San Francisco. They emigrated from their native country, China, remarried, and gave birth to children in America. The mothers and daughters bond by learning to understand each other and by overcoming their conflicts. The film begins with June's prologue tale. In China, Lindo Jong (Ying Wu) is arranged, by her mother (Xi Meijuan) and the matchmaker, to be married to Mrs Huang's son when she grows up.

Title: Little Darlings
PlotSummary: A group of teenage girls from Atlanta go to summer camp, and, unbeknownst to the adults, two of them make a bet as to which one will lose her virginity first. The girls involved in the contest are opposites and rivals: cynical, suspicious and streetwise poor girl Angel Bright, and naive, prissy and romantic rich girl Ferris Whitney. The two girls then choose "targets", or guys they want to be the ones they lose their virginity with. Both girls discover that sex is not what they thought it would be.

Title: Rhubarb
PlotSummary: Thaddeus J. Banner, a lonely, eccentric millionaire who owns a baseball team, the Brooklyn Loons, takes a liking to a stray cat. He names the cat "Rhubarb," which is baseball slang for an on-field argument or fight. When the man dies, it is discovered that his last will and testament made Rhubarb his sole beneficiary.

Title: The Right Person
PlotSummary: Margo Lorenz plays the newly married Martha Jorgensen, who is sat in her Copenhagen hotel room waiting for her husband, Jorgen, to return. She receives a visit from the mysterious Mr. Rasmusson (Douglas Wilmer) who claims to have been a "comrade" of her husband during World War II. He reveals that he and Jorgenson were two of a group of 12 men in the Danish underground resistance.

Title: Aadukalam
PlotSummary: In Madurai, veteran rooster trainer Pettaikaaran aka Pettai (V. I. S. Jayapalan) and Police Inspector Rathnaswamy (Naren) are tough competitors in cockfights. Karuppu (Dhanush) and Durai (Kishore) are the favorites in Pettai's team. Durai is very rich, owns three bars in the town of Thiruparangundram, and is also talented in cock training. Pettai decides to conduct a tournament in Ayubh's name and provide his family with funds, so that his family's daughters can

Title: Athaiya Mamiya
PlotSummary: Shankar(Jaishankar) returns from abroad after successfully completing his higher studies. Shankar's parents plan to marry off Shankar to one of their relative's daughter. A series of comic incidents. Things get serious when Shankar reveals to them that he already met the love of his life, Usha.

Title: An American Tail: Fievel Goes West
PlotSummary: Mousekewitz family immigrates to the U.S. in 1885. Cat R. Waul, an aristocrat cat forces the mice into the sewers, forcing them to move to a better life out west. Fievel overhears the cats' plot to turn them into "mouse burgers" and is thrown from the train by Cat R.'s hench-spider, T.R. Chula. Tiger chases the train, trying to catch up with his friends, but is thrown off course by a pack of angry dogs. Tiger is captured by mouse Indians and hailed as a god.

Title: Grand Prix
PlotSummary: A racing car driver accidentally kills his fiancee's father. The accident happened during a race car race. The father of the fiancee was killed by a racing car accident. The driver accidentally killed the father of her fiancee, who was killed in a car crash. The car crash is the first time a driver has accidentally killed a driver.

Title: Library Wars: The Last Mission
PlotSummary: Iku Kasahara is now a full-fledged member of the Library Defense 'Task Force' The Task Force are ordered to guard a public exhibition featuring ‘The Handbook of Library Law’, a book widely seen as the symbol of freedom, of which there is only one existing copy. The assignment seems easy enough, but this is in fact a trap designed to wipe out and thus disband the Task Force.

Title: Irma Vep
PlotSummary: Cheung is employed to play the film-within-the-film's heroine, Irma Vep, a burglar, who spends most of the film dressed in a tight, black, latex rubber catsuit. As the film progresses, the plot mirrors the disorientation felt by the film's director. The film questions the place of French cinema today.

Title: The Pumpkin Eater
PlotSummary: The story revolves around Jo Armitage (Bancroft), a woman with an ambiguous number of children from three marriages, who becomes negative and withdrawn after discovering that her third (and current) husband, Jake (Finch), has been unfaithful to her. After a series of loosely related events in which Jake's infidelity is balanced by his reliability as a breadwinner and a father, Jo and Jake take a tentative step toward reconciliation.

Title: The Spy: Undercover Operation
PlotSummary: Chul-soo is the greatest secret agent in South Korea, but at home he is a loving husband who's intimidated by his flight attendant wife Young-hee. One day he tells his wife that he'll be going to Busan for business, but actually travels with his department head Jin to Bangkok, Thailand to carry out a top secret operation with national ramifications.

Title: The Guest
PlotSummary: David Collins is a former army Sergeant and Caleb's best friend. He visits the Peterson family to help Caleb take care of Caleb's eldest son Caleb. David was a former test subject for a medical experiment in the military. He was "programmed" to kill anyone who might compromise his identity.

Title: Sarada Bullodu
PlotSummary: Vijay (Venkatesh), an engineer in AP Oils, stays with his widowed mother Shanta. Rajeswari Devi (Manjula), a greedy, cruel & crooked woman is the head of Attamadugu, whose word is a law for the villagers. The property that she is enjoying belongs to her brother Jaya Chandra (Murali Mohan) who is a drunkard. The film ends with the marriage of Vijay & Nirmala Devi.

Title: Ala Modalaindi
PlotSummary: Gautham (Nani) is abducted by John Abraham (Ashish Vidyarthi) on the way to stop a marriage. He is ready to propose to Simran (Kriti Kharbanda) with a bunch of red roses, but destiny has other plans. Elsewhere, Nithya (Nithya Menen) is playing cricket and hits him with her shot and he is taken to the hospital in the stretcher. He realises he's in love with her, but before he could tell her, he finds out that she is already engaged. He starts dating a veterinary doctor,

Title: The Great Commandment
PlotSummary: The film takes place in 30 A.D. Judea in a fictional village near Jerusalem. The protagonist is Joel, the elder son of the village rabbi Lamech. Joel is secretly a zealot leader, believing that more must be done to help his nation than studying the Scriptures. Joel runs afoul of his father in declaring his love for Tamar, whom his father wants wedded to Zadok, and in revealing that he is a leader. He comes up with the idea that he and the zealots would kidnap Jesus and force His hand to support them. This is forestalled by Jesus' appearance at

Title: Kiss Toledo Goodbye
PlotSummary: A young Ohio investment advisor must impersonate a Mafia Godfather for a few weeks following the assassination of his crime-boss biological father. He tries to keep this new life secret from his real family, especially from his very jealous fiancee (Christine Taylor), with the help of his new Cosa Nostra "family," especially his father's chief lieutenant.

Title: Black Friday
PlotSummary: The famous Dr. Ernest Sovac's best friend, George Kingsley, is run down while crossing a street. In order to save his friend's life, Sovac implants part of another man's brain into the professor's. Unfortunately, the other man was a gangster involved in the accident. The professor recovers but at times behaves like the gangster, and his whole personality changes.

Title: Poochudava
PlotSummary: The story is very simple and a usual typical Indian love story. It was Abbas' and Simran's second project together after a Telegu movie, Priya O Priya. Abbas (as Kannan) play the role of a rebellious college student in this movie. While Simran (as Nandhini) acts as his love lady.

Title: Santosh Subramaniam
PlotSummary: Subramaniam is a rich businessman managing his own construction company. He lives with his wife Shanthi and sons Sanjay and Santosh. Santosh, the younger son, does not like this as he wants to be independent and free from his father’s guidance and control. One day, Santosh meets Hasini, a college student and is attracted to her childish attitude and jovial nature. He does not have the courage to tell his father about his love affair to him. Hasini starts befriending Santosh's mother and sisters and gets close with them.

Title: Beverly Hills Brats
PlotSummary: Scooter (Billingsley) is a teen from a wealthy Beverly Hills family. After his plastic surgeon father (Sheen) remarries, Scooter is virtually ignored by his father and stepmother. Scooter devises a plan to fake his own kidnapping to get his parents' attention.

Title: The Wayward Bus
PlotSummary: Alice Chicoy decides to "surprise" her husband midway through his bus trip. Among the passengers, Camille Oakes is a shamed burlesque dancer on the way to a well-paying job in San Juan. Camille gets caught up in a flirtation with traveling salesman Ernest Horton.

Title: The Roots of Heaven
PlotSummary: Morel (Trevor Howard) is a crusading environmentalist who sets out to preserve the elephants from extinction. He is helped by Minna (Juliette Gréco), a nightclub hostess, and Forsythe (Errol Flynn) a disgraced British military officer.

Title: Esper Mami: Hoshizora no Dancing Doll[4]
PlotSummary: Mami Sakura used to be a normal junior high school student. She has supernatural powers such as telekinesis and telepathy. When she senses someone needs help, she uses the "Teleportation Gun" and transports herself there. She then saves the world in trouble with her psychic powers.

Title: Margam
PlotSummary: The film tells the story of a revolutionary who, years later, realizes that his efforts have been wasted and witnesses the ill-fate of his co-rebels and leads a secluded life in a state of clinical depression. The film is based on the novel, directed by Robert De Niro.

Title: My Cousin Rachel
PlotSummary: Philip Kendall is adopted by his cousin Ambrose Kendall, who raises him as a son on his large estate in Cornwall. Ambrose leaves the estate for the sunnier climate of Florence to marry his widowed cousin Rachel Kendall. Philip is convinced Rachel is guilty of murder and threatens her friend Rinaldi with revenge. Philip returns to Cornwall, and later learns Rachel has followed and has sex with her. Philip declares he and Rachel are engaged, but Rachel accuses him of madness.

Title: Folly to Be Wise
PlotSummary: Captain William Paris (Sim) is disheartened so few of the troops turn out for an evening of classical music. He decides to copy the idea of a 'brains trust' where panellists answer questions from the audience. The group includes the opinionated Professor Mutch, a popular radio personality on BBC radio, and the oil painter George Prout and his wife Angela.

Title: The Midnight Man
PlotSummary: Jim Slade (Lancaster) has just been released on parole from prison for shooting his wife's lover in their bed. Slade pursues an unauthorized investigation of his own. The film concludes with the sheriff offering Slade an apology and a job, even though, as a convicted violent felon, Slade cannot hold a position with the law.

Title: Woman of Desire
PlotSummary: Christina Ford (Bo Derek) a beautiful woman, is unhappily married to the older wealthy Walter J. Hill (Robert Mitchum) who employs Jack Lynch (Jeff Fahey) as his boat pilot. Christina meets a man named Jonathan Ashby (Steven Bauer) and begins having an affair behind her husband's back. Hill begins to have suspicions and orders her back to his boat. Not soon after, Hill is murdered, and police suspicions fall on Jack as being the culprit.

Title: Nick Carter, Master Detective
PlotSummary: Nick Carter boards an airliner with John Keller, the inventor of a revolutionary new aircraft. The pilot makes an unscheduled landing so that his confederates can try to steal Keller's plans. Carter holds them off, and stewardess Lou Farnsby manages to fly them to safety. Carter suspects Keller was strangled and the scene staged to look like a suicide. Each time a part of the blueprints goes missing, a worker has a serious accident and has to be sent home.

Title: Welcome to the Punch
PlotSummary: DI Max Lewinsky (McAvoy) is still suffering from his wound after being shot in the leg by Jacob Sternwood (Strong), who could have easily killed him but seems to have an aversion to killing. He works with a sidekick, DS Sarah Hawks (Andrea Riseborough), with whom he is on good terms. Lewinsky learns that Sternwood's son, Ruan, has collapsed on an aircraft runway while travelling under an alias and has been hospitalized. Ruan had made a call to an Iceland landline number before he collapsed, so the police intend to go to Iceland but Lewinsky has no faith

Title: Hot Potato
PlotSummary: The film is set in Chang Lan, a fictional country somewhere in east Asia. The villain Carter Rangoon (Sam Hiona) orchestrated the kidnapping of a U.S. senator's daughter a Ms. June Dunbar (Judith Brown) The group is joined by Johnny Chicago (Geoffrey Benney) and Pamala (Irene Tsu), a Chang Lan operative.

Title: The Mirror
PlotSummary: The film is divided into five unrelated segments with the mirror on an antique dressing table serving as the plot device. The first segment is set in a brothel in ancient China where a courtesan is murdered and her blood spills onto a mirror on her dressing table. The third segment is in Singapore in 1988 during the Ghost Festival. The fourth segment is a woman approaches the mirror and sees her eyeballs falling out from their sockets in her reflection.

Title: When My Baby Smiles at Me
PlotSummary: Bonny Kane and 'Skid' Johnson suffer marital difficulties when Skid gets an offer to appear on Broadway while Bonny gets left behind on the road. Things get worse with Skid's increasing drinking problem and the fact that the press has reported him to be spending a lot of time with his pretty co-star.

Title: The Prisoner of Second Avenue
PlotSummary: The story revolves around the escalating problems of a middle-aged couple living on Second Avenue on the Upper East Side of Manhattan, New York City. Mel Edison, the main character, has just lost his job after many years and now has to cope with being unemployed at middle age, during an economic recession.

Joseph Crone wakes in his hotel room on November 7, 2011 at 11:11AM. His manager, Grant, arrives and urges Joseph to write his next novel after telling him that his previous book sold over 5 million copies. Joseph gets a call from his estranged brother, Samuel, who is living in Spain with their father, Richard. Joseph is then immediately in a car accident and the doctors reveal to him that he is perfectly healthy and uninjured while the other driver was killed in the crash. Joseph becomes convinced that Samuel is a prophet to save the church and that on November 11, 2011, Samuel will be sacrificed by

Title: Rustlers' Hideout
PlotSummary: Billy and Fuzzy lead a cattle drive and face a gang of ruthless rustlers. The gang use gambling debts and poisoning water holes to stop Billy's herd. Billy leads the cattle drive against the gang of rustlers who use gambling debt and poisoning to stop his herd.

Title: Rudranetra
PlotSummary: Agent Netra (chiranjeevi), a Casanova works for a Detective agency run by Satyanarayana (Ranganath) He is given a special assignment to track down the underworld activities and their drug dealings of a bigwig in the society, but has another shade as don of the Illegal drug trade. He uses his elder daughter Rekha to experiment all his drugs.

Title: Fight Club – Members Only
PlotSummary: The story follows four friends, Vicky (Zayed Khan), Karan (Dino Morea), Somil (Riteish Deshmukh) and Diklesh a.k.a. Diku (Aashish Chaudhary) The four love hanging out, late night partying and drinking booze. One night, they witness a physical brawl, and Vicky comes up with the idea of making a "Fight Club", in which the participants will be allowed to fight physically non-stop. Mohit (Yash Tonk), a college youngster, enters the club and takes part in a fight

Title: Gaily, Gaily
PlotSummary: Set in 1910, the film's main character is Ben Harvey (patterned after Ben Hecht) who leaves his home for Chicago. He meets Lil, who in reality is the madam of the bordello Ben mistakes for a boarding house. While he tries to find work, Ben encounters other people, including a man named Sullivan, who is involved in shady doings in city government.

Title: Captain Phillips
PlotSummary: Richard Phillips takes command of MV Maersk Alabama, an unarmed container ship from the Port of Salalah in Oman, with orders to sail through the Gulf of Aden to Mombasa, Kenya. During a drill, the vessel is chased by Somali pirates in two skiffs, and Phillips calls for help. As they board, Phillips tells the crew to hide in the engine room and allows himself to be captured. The crew members ambush Muse, holding him at knifepoint, and arrange to release him and the other pirates into a lifeboat. Muse's orders are to ransom the ship and crew in exchange for

Title: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind
PlotSummary: Joel Barish and Clementine Kruczynski begin a relationship on a train from Montauk to Rockville Centre. After a fight, Clementine had hired the New York City firm Lacuna, Inc. to erase all of her memories of their relationship. Joel was devastated and decided to undergo the procedure himself.

Title: Me, Myself & Irene
PlotSummary: Charlie Baileygates (Jim Carrey) is a veteran Rhode Island State Police trooper who has been taken advantage of by those around him. As a result of years of such treatment, Charlie develops a split personality named Hank to deal with the confrontations Charlie avoids. Hank is an over-the-top, rude, and violent persona reminiscent of characters played by Clint Eastwood. The FBI suspects that Charlie is responsible for the murder of an EPA agent.

Title: Inaam Dus Hazaar
PlotSummary: Kamal Malhotra (Sanjay Dutt) is a salesman working with a table-fan manufacturing firm. One night in a jewel exhibition, he meets the Nawab of Chandrapur (Raza Murad) Kamal gets accused of the murder of a diamond dealer. He flees from the police and travels by the same train in which Luca is travelling. He meets Sonia Shrivastav (Meenakshi Seshadri) and falls in love with her. Sonia later tells Kamal that she is a model and works for Captain S.P. Singh.

Title: The Virtuous Sin
PlotSummary: Marya is the wife of medical student Victor Sablin, who finds it impossible to deal with military life. Victor is sentenced to death by firing squad due to his insubordination. Marya offers herself to General Gregori Platoff in order to save him. When the two unexpectedly fall in love, Victor threatens to kill his rival.

Title: The Brothers
PlotSummary: The film has separate subplots with each character, showing how their friendships binds them. Jackson Smith struggles with commitment issues and often has nightmares of being shot by a bride. Brian Palmer is working to gain custody of his younger brother who currently lives in a affection-less household with his mother. Derrick is trying to convince his wife to let his ailing mother live in their home.

Title: Circus
PlotSummary: Dayaal, who spoke with emotional overtones in the film, said that he will be completing the film after sixty days of schedule. Director has taken permission from Railway authorities to shoot the film in Railway station and tracks in Mysore, Konkan Railway and Railway line stretching in Sakleshpura and Subramanya Ghat section.

Title: The Woman Between
PlotSummary: A young man returns from Europe after several years' estrangement from his family caused by his disapproval of his father's remarrying after his mother's death. At the family reunion he learns that his stepmother is the woman he had a shipboard romance on the voyage home.

Title: Borat! Cultural Learnings of America for Make Benefit Glorious Nation of Kazakhstan
PlotSummary: Kazakh reporter Borat Sagdiyev leaves Kazakhstan for the United States, which he called "Greatest Country in the World", the "U, S and A", to make a documentary. In New York, the cultural differences are highlighted when Borat washes his face with toilet water, masturbates to a mannequin and defecates in front of Trump Tower. During the trip, Borat acquires a Baywatch booklet and continues gathering footage for his documentary.

Title: Butler, TheThe Butler
PlotSummary: Cecil Gaines recounts his life story while waiting at the White House to meet the newly inaugurated president. Gaines is raised on a cotton plantation in Macon, Georgia, when the farm's owner rapes Cecil's mother, Cecil's father is killed. In 1957, Cecil is hired by White House during Dwight D. Eisenhower's administration. Cecil repeatedly confronts supervisor over unequal pay and career advancement provided to black White House staff.

Title: Ilamai Oonjal
PlotSummary: Some college students from Chennai go on vacation trip to a hill station. On their trip, girls get killed one by one in a thrilling manner. The rest of the story is why they got killed and who is the killer. It is also the mystery of who is responsible for the killings.

Title: The Vow
PlotSummary: Rachel McAdams (Rachel McAdams) and her husband Leo (Channing Tatum) first met at the Art Institute of Chicago. On their way home, at a stop sign, Paige unbuckles her seatbelt to lean over and kiss Leo. At that very moment, a truck rams their car from behind and Paige crashes through the windshield. When Paige regains consciousness, she thinks Leo is her doctor, having lost all memories of the past few years. Her parents insist on taking her home with them and Paige agrees.

Title: Country Town
PlotSummary: A severe drought strikes the town of Bellbird, Australia. The locals rally together and hold a fund-raising gymkhana. Young reporter Philip Henderson arrives and stirs old tensions. The film follows a series of events in Bellbird which end in a blaze of controversy.

Title: Ainthu Ainthu Ainthu
PlotSummary: Aravind (Bharath) had met with a terrible accident seven months ago, that left him physically and emotionally scarred. He claims that during the accident, his girlfriend Liyana (Mrithika) was with him and she died in his arms. No one has seen or even heard of her; she does not appear in the student list in her college or even the census reports. She is not mentioned in the newspaper reports of the accident either and some strangers are occupying her home.

Title: Dawn on the Great Divide
PlotSummary: Rough Riders protect a wagon train and supplies for the railroad against a power hungry businessman who dresses his army of henchmen as Indians. The Rough Riders are the result of a battle between the Rough Riders and a businessman who dresses up as Indians in a costume. The film is set in New York City, New York.

Title: Rock 'n' Roll High School
PlotSummary: The movie is set in 1980. Vince Lombardi High School keeps losing principals to nervous breakdowns because of the students' love of rock 'n' roll and their disregard for education. The students, joined by the Ramones, take over the high school, with Miss Togar asking the musicians "Do your parents know you're Ramones?"

Title: Hi Diddle Diddle
PlotSummary: Young Janie Prescott is about to be married to her sailor sweetheart, Sonny Phyffe, but the wedding is delayed because the ship hasn't arrived to its dock. The wedding ceremony has to be pushed forward, and is combined with a christening ceremony that is to be performed by the same pastor. Janie is then called to service as an air raid warden before she has time to go away on her honeymoon.

Title: Ladies Only
PlotSummary: Sabita Devi (Gujarat), Bibbo (Punjab), and Prabha (Bengal) meet at a railway station. With no place to stay they decide to find accommodation together. A young crook (Surendra) enters their life and trouble starts brewing between the girls.

Title: Anna and the Apocalypse
PlotSummary: The zombie apocalypse hits the sleepy town of Little Haven at Christmas. Anna and her high school friends have to fight, sing and dance to survive to survive. The zombie horde is all around them, with the undead horde all around Anna and friends fighting, singing and dancing.

Title: Kaanal Neer
PlotSummary: Suren (Nageswara Rao) hails from a zamindari family. Unable to get permission to pursue his studies, he leaves home and reaches Madras, hiding his identity. His elder daughter Madhavi (Bhanumathi) has become a widow at a young age. Hearing about the goodness of the teacher, she gets drawn to him though she has never met him. Later, due to mischievous relatives, she begins to dislike him and dismisses him.

Title: Yamla Pagla Deewana
PlotSummary: Paramvir Singh (Sunny Deol) is a Non-resident Indian (NRI) living happily with his Canadian wife Mary (Emma Brown Garett) along with his two kids Karam and Veer and his mother (Nafisa Ali) in Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada. Paramvir's mother sends him to Banaras to find his father, and younger brother Gajodhar Singh. Dharam Singh (Dharmendra) had run away from home after the birth of his younger brother, Paramvir.

Title: The Seventh Sin
PlotSummary: In post-World War II Hong Kong, unhappily married Carol (Eleanor Parker) has an affair with a married man, Paul (Jean Pierre Aumont) Her physician husband Walter (Bill Travers) discovers it and presents her with a choice: travel with him to a remote mainland village (where he will fight a cholera epidemic) or face the scandal of a very public divorce. She persuades him to reconsider and he proposes an alternative: If Paul's wife will agree to a divorce and he marries Carol within one week Walter will obtain a quiet divorce. Shortly after, Walter contracts chol

Title: Bridget Jones: The Edge of Reason
PlotSummary: Bridget (Renée Zellweger) is ecstatic about her relationship with Mark Darcy (Colin Firth) However, Bridget's confidence in her relationship is shattered when she meets Mark's assistant, a beautiful, slim and quick witted Australian named Rebecca Gillies (Jacinda Barrett) Bridget meets her ex, Daniel Cleaver (Hugh Grant), at her job for TV morning show Sit-Up Britain and is offered a position alongside Cleaver in a new travel tv series. Bridget is arrested and sent to a Thai prison after airport security dogs detect a large stash of cocaine inside the gift.

Title: Get Low
PlotSummary: Felix Bush (Robert Duvall) shows up in town with a fat wad of cash, requesting a "funeral party" at Reverend Gus Horton's church for himself. Frank Quinn (Bill Murray) agrees to advertise a funeral party at which the townsfolk will be invited to tell Felix Bush the stories they've heard about him. Bush tells those gathered at his funeral party (including Mattie Darrow) what happened forty years earlier. He reveals his affair with Mattie's married sister, Mary Lee, who was his girlfriend in their youth, and her deceased sister.

Title: Kickin' It Old Skool
PlotSummary: In 1986, 12-year-old Justin "Rocketshoe" Schumacher and his breakdancing group, The Funky Fresh Boyz, are ready for the annual talent show. In an effort to impress Jennifer and win the contest, Justin uses a dangerous and untested headspin maneuver, which caused him to flip off the stage and to fall into a coma. Twenty years later, Justin is still in the hospital and in a coma; his parents pull the plug on him. As a result of his two-decade-long coma, Justin now finds himself suddenly 31 years old, going on 32.

Title: Paartha Gnabagam Illayo
PlotSummary: Twin sisters Kasthuri and Lalitha are separated at a very young age. They were raised by Radharavi who had greed for money and a lavish lifestyle. He planned to marry Kasthur to a rich old man even after knowing that she was in love with Anand Babu. Meanwhile, Lalitha is married to her dream man and lives happily with him. Resolving Confusions and reuniting them form the crux of the story.

Title: The Age of Adaline
PlotSummary: Adaline Bowman was born on New Years Day 1908, then later married and gave birth to a daughter, only to become a widow after her husband died in a tragic accident. Years later, in 1937, Adaline crashed her car when she swerved into a ravine during a snowstorm and died in the freezing lake nearby, but a lightning strike suddenly revived her. Ever since, she has changed her identification and address according to the era, while her daughter Flemming ages normally.

Title: Seeta Rama Jananam
PlotSummary: The film traces the Ramayana from the time Dasaratha (T. Venkateswarlu) kills the son of a blind couple, long before Lord Rama (ANR) is born, to the time the wedding of Seeta (Tripurasundari) is performed. The story included roles of Vasishta (Parupalli Sathyanarayana), Kausalya (Rushyendramani), Sumithra (Annapurna) and Kaika.

Title: Poodle Springs
PlotSummary: Linda and Marlowe first met in The Long Goodbye and their romance resumed at the end of Playback. The couple relocate to a grand mansion in Poodle Springs (a mocking reference to Palm Springs) and open a detective agency in the resort. Marlowe's first case comes when he is forced by hoodlums to visit a local criminal named Lipschultz who operates an illegal gambling house in Riverside, just outside the jurisdiction of Poodle Spings.

Title: Chase a Crooked Shadow
PlotSummary: Kimberly Prescott (Baxter) is grieving after her father's recent suicide. She is taken aback by the arrival of a man (Todd) claiming to be her brother Ward. Kimberly has trouble convincing her friends and family and the local police inspector that a complete stranger has taken her deceased brother's identity.

Title: Ooty Varai Uravu
PlotSummary: Vijaya (L. Vijayalakshmi) is the daughter of a wealthy zamindar. Vedachalam (T. S. Balaiah) is married to Sundari and has a son, Ravi (Sivaji Ganesan) who is now taking care of the family business. After Sivakami's death, his daughter decides to seek him out and sets out to confront him with proof of his second marriage. She runs away from home after her parents death, her uncle tries to marry her in order to acquire her wealth. She meets Ravi on the train and she

Title: Speedway Junky
PlotSummary: The film stars Jesse Bradford as Johnny, a young man with dreams of becoming a stock car racer. Daryl Hannah plays Veronica, a former showgirl and prostitute who has served as a surrogate mother figure for Eric since his own mother died. Eric falls deeply in love with Johnny, and is saddened that his love will remain unrequited.

Title: Home Sweet Hell
PlotSummary: Don Champagne (Patrick Wilson) runs a successful furniture business. His wife Mona (Katherine Heigl) has everything planned according to the book of her goals. One day an attractive young woman named Dusty (Jordana Brewster) applies for the job as saleswoman at Don’s store. She tells Don that she is pregnant and wants to keep the baby. Don is desperate because of his poor sex life with his wife. Don confesses to Mona and she demands that Don kill Dusty.

Title: Assault on Wall Street
PlotSummary: In 2008 financial crisis, a portfolio-manager instructs his employees to neglect the best-interest of clients in order to increase company profits. Meanwhile, Jim Baxford (Dominic Purcell), a former soldier and armored car driver, lives with his wife, Rosie, in New York City. Rosie is in the process of recovering from a near-fatal brain tumor. Jim becomes frustrated at the loss of his money and his inability to pay for his wife's treatment and their mortgage.

Title: Annie
PlotSummary: Annie Bennett lives in foster care with several other girls under the care of Colleen Hannigan, a bitter former singer who spends her days drinking or trying to find a husband. Annie is saved by William Stacks, a germaphobe cell phone mogul running for mayor. Annie's rescue goes viral on the internet, boosting Stacks' popularity; Annie moves in with Stacks to boost his popularity further. Annie also gets to adopt the stray dog from before, naming her Sandy.

Title: Kaizoku Sentai Gokaiger vs. Space Sheriff Gavan: The Movie
PlotSummary: The Gokaigers (sans Gai, who was sent off to buy dinner for them before this incident) confront the legendary Space Sheriff Gavan, who quickly defeats and apprehends them. Retsu Ichijouji delivers his prisoners to Space Police Chief Weeval, who reveals himself as Ashurada, a member of the Zangyack Empire and descendant of Don Horror. In the midst of the battle, the salute given by Retsu triggers a flashback in Captain Marvelous' mind. Back on Earth, Basco and Sally make their way toward the unguarded Gokai Galleon to steal the

Title: Her Minor Thing
PlotSummary: Newscaster boyfriend accidentally reveals Jeana is still a virgin despite being in her mid 20s. The revelation of her virginity has made her a target for every oversexed man in the immediate area. In the end, she finds a man, a photographer, who is decent enough to be the man to whom she finally loses her virginity.

Title: Pudsey: The Movie
PlotSummary: Pudsey uses his ability to walk on his hind legs and knock people over to save the day. He starts as a dog in a movie set, but he ends up fired after causing havoc. He runs away in disgrace and catches a bus, and catches several school kids on there. When the bus stops, he runs down the street and knocks the bullies over. The bullied kids take him home with them and take him to a lady who looks after dogs. But the lady turns out to be evil after she says she is going to dye him pink.

Title: Sky Devils
PlotSummary: Lifeguards Wilkie (Spencer Tracy) and Mitchell (George Cooper) who can not even swim, are trying to keep out of the war. The two friends swear they will never join the Army but relent and later, wind up in uniform, shovelling manure. Determined to find a way out, Wilkie and Mitchell desert and head off to South America. After stowing away on a ship, they find out they are on a troop ship with Army Air Corps pilots going to France.

Title: Head Over Heels
PlotSummary: Charles Richardson is a civil servant in his early 30s, working in Salt Lake City, Utah. He meets Laura Conley in the filing department of his office and it is love at first sight. Soon, she moves in with him and seems happy, but starts having second thoughts. Laura leaves Charles and goes back to her husband, Ox, a log home salesman.

Title: Zenda
PlotSummary: The movie is based on actual life of party workers who have aligned their loyalty towards a particular political party based on its apex leader. It highlights the glorious past of party and strong organisation fighting for Marathi community in Maharashtra, India. The movie also touches on the part where political images have been built completely based on media and PR exercises.

Title: High Fidelity
PlotSummary: Rob Gordon is a self-confessed music loving everyman with a poor understanding of women. He is dumped by his latest girlfriend, Laura, and attempts to understand what is the failure in his relationships by seeking out old partners. By day, he holds court at his record store, Championship Vinyl, where customers drift through. His helping hands are Dick and Barry, the "musical moron twins"

Title: The Man Who Finally Died
PlotSummary: Joe Newman returns to his small hometown in Bavaria, after living in England since the outbreak of World War II. He finds out that his father is dead, but that he escaped from behind the Iron Curtain and went to live with a certain Dr. von Brecht, and that he later married a woman named Lisa. Joe begins to suspect that this is a cover-up and that the people want to keep certain facts regarding his father a secret.

Title: Alvin and the Chipmunks
PlotSummary: The Chipmunks meet struggling songwriter and composer, David Seville, who has had his latest song rejected by JETT Records chief executive, Ian Hawke. After a misunderstanding with Dave, they go to Ian in an attempt to obtain a record deal. They are enchanted with Ian at first, but once they set off on a nationwide coast-to-coast tour, he takes advantage of their naïvete, changing their image and working them constantly. Dave decides to take matters himself by infiltrating their concert to reunite with them.

Title: Tale of Zatoichi Continues !The Tale of Zatoichi Continues
PlotSummary: One year after the first film, Zatōichi travels back to the town near the Joshoji Temple, to pay respects at the grave of Hirate, the samurai he killed. Zatoichi defeats the first three attackers, and retires to a restaurant. Later the lord's men hire local yakuza (gangsters) to finish the job. Yoshiro arrives and says he wants to kill his younger brother in revenge for crippling him. He tells Sukegoro that two men have died for him in his petty crime, and he too must die.

The story takes place in Pakistan in 1977, six years after the 1971 Bangladesh Liberation War. It takes place based on the role of Indian army who came forward to help in the freedom of Bangladesh from Pakistan on the orders of then Indian Prime Minister Indira Gandhi. The title of the movie alludes to the year when this War between Bangladesh and Pakistan took place.

Title: Sneh Bandhan
PlotSummary: Snehlata lives with her postmaster father and is in love with Gopal who is poor but well-educated. When Gopal comes to visit Sneha, Pratap in a jealous rage kills him. Sneha takes the blame and is jailed for ten years. In jail, Sneha gives birth to a son who she gives up for adoption to the jail's matron, Sushila, with the promise that it should not be revealed to him who his real parents are.

Title: Aap Ke Saath
PlotSummary: Ashok and Vimal are two grandsons of K.K. Vimal, who is a womanizer. Ashok pays some money to Ganga and hopes never to see her again. Vimal frequently visits a courtesan, Ashok finds that the courtesan is none other than Ganga.

Title: The Fugitive
PlotSummary: A nameless and conflicted Catholic priest is a fugitive in an unnamed Latin American country where religion is outlawed. Another fugitive, a murderous bandit dubbed "El Gringo", comes to town and conspire to help the priest escape. The priest is captured and sentenced to death, but forgives the informant for betraying him.

Title: Cutthroat Island
PlotSummary: In 1668 Jamaica, Morgan Adams hunts down her uncle and fellow pirate Dawg Brown, who has captured her father, Black Harry. Black Harry has one of three pieces of a map to a huge stash of gold on the remote Cutthroat Island. After scalping her dead father for the piece, Morgan sets out for the treasure. The instructions appear to be in Latin, which no one on board reads.

Title: Above and Beyond
PlotSummary: Col. Paul W. Tibbets, Jr. (Robert Taylor) is assigned to a dangerous mission in testing a new bomber, the Boeing B-29 Superfortress. The perilous assignment has caused his wife Lucy (Eleanor Parker) to worry for his life and whether their marriage can survive the constant separations.

Title: Jallikattu Kaalai
PlotSummary: Gopalakrishnan (Prabhu) works in a mill owned by Sundara Gounder (Malaysia Vasudevan) Radha (Kanaka) returns to the village after her studies and falls in love with her love. Knowing of his daughter's love, Sundara arranges her marriage to Radha with a fraud. Her fiancé agrees to leave Radha for one night with Loose Goundser. Loose is a vicious man who has raped and killed women. Radha misunderstands a conversation between Gopalakhrishnan and a woman who lies that she had a sexual

Title: 711 Ocean Drive
PlotSummary: Mal Granger (Edmond O'Brien) is a telephone repairman who likes to bet on the horses. He takes control of the wire service, making him a target for the Los Angeles Police. East Coast mobster Larry Mason (Don Porter) is sent by boss Carl Stephans (Otto Kruger) to persuade Granger to join the Syndicate.

Title: The Idol
PlotSummary: A rebellious student embarks on an affair with the mother of his best friend, leading to disastrous consequences. The film is based on the story of a rebellious student who is obsessed with his friend's mother. The story is set in New York City, New York, and is set to be released in October.

Title: Napoleon
PlotSummary: In Sydney, a puppy named Muffin is living with a human family and his own mother. He wishes to be with the wild dogs that he can hear howling in the distance. Napoleon flies high above the city and heads out to the sea. A galah named Birdo drops down on the side of his basket and offers to help him get down. Napoleon panics due to a fear of water, but Birdo's idea of help is to pop the balloons suspending the basket.

Title: Kadhal Virus
PlotSummary: Deepak is a budding filmmaker trying to get his first production out. He meets and falls in love with Geetha, and decides to take his relationship with her further once his first film is made. Misunderstandings lead to their separation and her eventual marriage to Rajiv, a struggling actor.

Title: The Law of Men
PlotSummary: Laura Dayne (Bennett), an ambitious young sculptress courted by neighboring artist Denis Connors (Welch), has limited contact with the social world and knows little of the "law of men" and so unsuspicious when decadent architect Jamison Keene lures her to the Tarrytown Inn. Keene had recently had the artist paint a miniature of Mildred Wade (Matthews), the foolish wife of Laura's dear friend Benton Wade (Robson)

Title: Cry, the Beloved Country
PlotSummary: Stephen Kumalo (Canada Lee) journeys to Johannesburg to search for his missing son, Absolom, only to find his people living in squalor. Reverend Misimangu (Sidney Poitier) helps find Kumalo's sons and sister-turned-prostitute in the slums of Johannesburg.

Title: Spider
PlotSummary: Dennis Cleg has just been released from a mental institution and in his new abode starts piecing together or recreating in his memory an apparently fateful childhood event. A shift takes place in the child's psyche when he witnesses his mother groping with his father in the garden and, subsequently, when he sees his mother in a silky night gown she wore for his father.

Title: Just Married
PlotSummary: Working-class Tom Leezak and upper-class Sarah McNerney meet up when Tom accidentally hits Sarah with a football. A few months later, despite opposition from Sarah's rich family, they get married. They have kept a secret from each other: Tom doesn't tell Sarah that he accidentally killed her dog and she reveals she slept with Peter Prentiss.

Title: Sherlock Holmes in Washington
PlotSummary: British secret agent Alfred Pettibone is murdered on his way to deliver a secret document in the USA. Holmes deduces Pettibon converted the document to microfilm before his death. Before his death, the microfilm, hidden inside a "V for Victory" matchbook, was in the unwitting hands of Washington debutante and bride-to-be Nancy Partridge. The matchbook gets passed from hand to hand at a party unknowingly and end up in the inadvertent possession of chief spy Heinrich Hinkel.

Title: Do Badan
PlotSummary: Vikas (Manoj Kumar) comes from a poor family, and is attending college so that he can complete his studies, get a job, and look after himself and his dad. He meets wealthy Asha (Asha Parekh) at this college, and after a few misunderstandings, both fall in love. Vikas' dad passes away during the exams, and Asha arranges an accident for Vikas. Asha's dad wants her to get married to Ashwini (Pran), and he soon announces their engagement. He finds out that Asha is in love with Vikas, and arr

Title: Adventures in Babysitting
PlotSummary: Chris Parker babysits the Andersons' daughter, 8-year-old Sara, while they attend a party in downtown Chicago. Brad Anderson is supposed to go to his friend Daryl Coopersmith's house to spend the night, but he changes his mind when he finds that Chris is the babysitter. Brad and Sara are car-jacked by a thief named Joe Gipp, who is chided by Graydon, the operation's second-in-command, for bringing witnesses. They are detained in an upstairs office but escape; they enter a blues club where the band on stage won't let them leave until they

Title: 13 Moons
PlotSummary: The film opens with a clown (Buscemi) whose wife (Beals) and stripper girlfriend (Parsons) just discovered each other's existence. On the way to the hospital, they are accosted by a crazed drug addict named Slovo (Stormare) who is hit by a car soon after. The five meet up with an angry record producer (Mitchell) and the girlfriend he believes to be pregnant (Rollins)

Title: Jiao Yulu
PlotSummary: In late 1962, Jiao Yulu was appointed the second party boss of Lankao County in Henan province. He was soon promoted to party boss because of his excellent work. On May 14, 1964, he died at the age of forty-two from liver cancer.

Title: The Wind That Shakes the Barley
PlotSummary: Dr. Damien O'Donovan is about to leave his native village to practise medicine in a London hospital. Meanwhile, his brother Teddy commands the local flying column of the Irish Republican Army. After the Anglo-Irish Treaty is signed, the brigade learns that a partitioned Ireland will only be granted Dominion status within the British Empire.

Title: Breakfast with Scot
PlotSummary: Eric McNally (Tom Cavanagh) is a gay retired hockey player turned television sportscaster. He lives with his partner Sam (Ben Shenkman), a sports lawyer. Sam unexpectedly becomes the legal guardian of his brother's stepson, Scot. Their lives are turned upside down as the demands of being a parent begin to intrude.

Title: The Scarecrow
PlotSummary: The film opens with an elderly witch, who reveals herself to be a kindly witch, telling the audience about the town of Grisham Heights. She explains the town's workhouse mill, where orphans and debtors are sent to work off their debts, and that it takes thirteen pieces of silver to buy your freedom. The witch then introduces the audience to Polly, a girl who has been in the mill nearly her whole life, but has been saving her silver coins and hiding them at the foot of her scarecrow. As the years pass, Scarecrow begins to fall in love with Polly after her constant visits. Meanwhile,

Title: Manners of Dying
PlotSummary: Kevin Barlow (Roy Dupuis) will die on schedule and according to regulations. Harry Parlington (Serge Houde), director of the Cantos execution facility, intends to make sure of it. However Barlow chooses to go, be it calmly or fighting to the end, Parlington feels confident that he and his team can deal with the situation.

Title: Young and Innocent
PlotSummary: Robert Tisdall (Derrick De Marney) is the only suspect in the murder of Christine Clay (Pamela Carme), a successful actress, at a retreat on the English coast. Christine Clay was strangled with the belt from a raincoat; his raincoat is missing and he says it was recently stolen. The authorities assume the two have been having an affair, but the authorities think they have hit upon motive and Tisdal is arrested. He escapes with the aid of Erica Burgoyne, daughter of the local police Chief Constable, who is taken in by the police.

Title: Maa
PlotSummary: Ram Khanna is a wealthy industrialist with a trusting soul. Unknown to him, his elder brother Murli Manohar and his sister-in-law Maya are after his money. Murli and Maya hire a goon named Gullu Goli to kill Mamta and trap her. Mamta takes control of Ram's life to thwart the duo.

Title: The Delicious Little Devil
PlotSummary: Mary McGuire (Mae Murray) is a working-class young girl who lives in a New York tenement. Murray in a thinly disguised portrayal obviously mimicking fellow real life dancer/star Gaby Deslys. The Duke de Sauterne (Bertram Grassby) has arrived in New York from Europe.

Title: Shall We Dance?
PlotSummary: John Clark is a lawyer with a charming wife, Beverly, and a loving family. Each evening on his commute home through Chicago, John sees a beautiful woman staring with a lost expression through the window of a dance studio. As his lessons continue, John falls in love with ballroom dancing. His friendship with Paulina blossoms as his enthusiasm rekindles her own lost passion for dance.
