Title: Arthur Christmas
PlotSummary: On Christmas Eve, hundreds of Christmas elves helm the command centre of Santa Claus's mile-wide[6] ultra-high-tech sleigh-esque craft, the S-1. The current Santa named Malcolm and the Christmas elves deliver presents to every child in the world using advanced equipment and military precision. Meanwhile, his younger son - the clumsy, fearful yet enthusiastic yet enthusiastic Arthur - devotedly answers the letters to Santa. During one of the delivery operations in Germany a child wakes up and almost sees Malcolm due to an accidentally activated toy; in the tense escape operation, a present to fall from the supply line.

Title: The Woman's Angle
PlotSummary: Story of three love affairs of man who belongs to celebrated family of musicians, culminating in divorce and his final discovery of happiness.[2] Story of divorce and love affair culminates into divorce and discovery of new happiness. Story of love affair ends in divorce, ending in divorce.

Title: Cool...Sakkath Hot Maga
PlotSummary: Ganesh plays a college going student in the film. The film has been shot in some picturesque locations such as Egypt, Dubai and Jordan and Middle East. It has supposedly a comedy and romance mixed storyline. Ganesh played a college student in film which is based in Egypt and Dubai.

Title: Tom at the Farm (Tom à la ferme)
PlotSummary: Tom, a young advertising editor, visits Guillaume's rural community to deliver a eulogy at the funeral of his boyfriend. He is surprised when Agathe Longchamp tells him Guillasume has a brother, Francis. Francis tells Agathe they named a calf Bitch Ass, in Tom's honour. Tom decides not to speak, and Francis confronts Tom in a bathroom stall about the mishap. Agathe becomes overwhelmed with questions about Sarah's apparent lack of grief.

Title: The Gang's All Here
PlotSummary: Frankie O'Malley (Darro) and Jefferson Smith (Moreland) apply for work at the Overland Transport Company, a firm run by Pop Wallace (Homans) The boys are unaware that a trucking war is in progress and that Wallace's trucks are being wrecked and his men killed. Meanwhile, George Lee (Luke) an undercover agent for the insurance company that is covering Overland's claims, has learned that Pop Wallace is working with Ray Saunders (Mitchell)

Title: The Brothers Rico
PlotSummary: Eddie Rico is the happily married owner of a prosperous laundry company in Bayshore, Florida. He has given up his ties to the syndicate and hopes to adopt a child with his wife, Alice. His two brothers, Johnny (James Darren) and Gino (Paul Picerni) have disappeared.

Title: Flame of Youth
PlotSummary: Jerry Briggs, nicknamed Jerry, is arrested for stealing hubcaps off cars. She goes to gangster Cicero Coletti to get her cut of the stolen loot, quarreling with Coletti's sister, Lila. She ignores sister Catherine's pleas to get out of petty crime and concentrate on becoming a fashion model.

Title: That's My Mommy
PlotSummary: A mother duck is sleeping on her nest of eggs, but one of the egg suddenly rolls from the nest and begins to hatch. The duckling, Quacker, slips under a sleeping Tom outside and hatches underneath him, causing Quacker to assume Tom as his mother. Tom decides to inherit his mistaken role to keep a hold of the duckling and try to eat him. Jerry rescues Quacker by placing Tom's tail on the rotisserie.

Title: Golden Hoofs
PlotSummary: Jane Drake is devastated when her dad Dr. Tim Drake's farm is sold to Dean MacArdle, who also intends to abandon the longtime tradition of harness racing. Dean is kind enough to sell Jane her favorite trotter, Yankee Doodle, for just $5. She persuades Dean to enter Doodle's old stablemate, Yankee Clipper, in the upcoming "Hiatoga Stakes"

Title: Paradise
PlotSummary: David and Sarah travel with a caravan from Baghdad to Damascus in 1823. At an oasis, a white slaver known as 'the Jackal' raids the party and attempts to add the beautiful young Sarah to his harem. The Jackal does not give up hope of capturing Sarah, so David must lure him to his death.

Title: Donga
PlotSummary: Phani (Chiranjeevi) commits thefts just to help the poor. He wants revenge against Kodandaramayya (Rao Gopala Rao) for killing his father. He also wants his sister Malathi (Rajyalakshmi) to get married to Rajesh (Raja), son of Anjaneyulu.

Title: The Vampire's Ghost
PlotSummary: Roy Hendrick (Charles Gordon) returns to the village of Bakunda after a short absence to find that there has been a series of strange murders where each victim was bitten the neck and drained of blood. The local Natives are certain it is the work of a vampire, but Roy, his girlfriend Julie Vance (Peggy Stewart) and her father Thomas Vance (Emmett Vogen) do not believe in such superstitious nonsense.

Title: Uncle Silas
PlotSummary: Caroline Ruthyn is the niece of her elderly uncle Silas, who becomes her guardian on the death of her father. The fact that Silas is broke and greedy is reason enough for Caroline to be wary. Her fears increase when she meets Silas's perverted son and when she discovers that her fearsome former governess, Madame de la Rougierre, is working with her uncle.

Title: The Bone Collector
PlotSummary: Tetraplegic forensics expert Lincoln Rhyme and patrol cop Amelia Donaghy team up to solve a string of murders connected to a serial killer by his signature: a single shard of bone removed from each of the victims. The killer poses as a New York City taxi driver and abducts and kills those who get in his taxi. The detectives find Mrs. Rubin at a steam junction in a below-ground services area of a building in the Financial District.

Title: Curry and Pepper
PlotSummary: Police detectives Curry and Pepper are two CID detectives that do not take their jobs seriously. When newspaper reporter Joey Law decides to film a documentary about daily police life, she chooses to film them. Eventually, the two reconcile and work together to take down a vicious hit man named Abalone.

Title: Dil Ne Jise Apna Kahaa
PlotSummary: Dil Ne Jise Apna Kahaa begins with Rishabh (Salman Khan) and Pari (Preity Zinta) who are deeply in love. Pari has a dream to create a hospital for children. Her last wish was to donate her heart to her patient Dhani (Bhoomika Chawla) Dhani is cured, much to the joy of her family and her grandmother.

Title: Waris
PlotSummary: The story revolves around a young prince with socialist ideas who runs away from the palace. Twenty years later, after news of the death of the king, three pretenders arrive, each claiming to be the real prince. Meanwhile, the original prince sees the news and reveals his identity to her mother, with whom he is living by his false identity as an orphan.

Title: Brahma
PlotSummary: In 1600 BC a warrior named Brahma (Upendra) is very kind to poor. He gives all his wealth to the poor. But in 1950, their family becomes very poor. Then Veer Brahma says that he will take all the wealth his grandfather gave to others. Then Bramha is taken to court and he is sentenced to 2 years in jail. After two years, he is now the chief minister of Karnataka. The Lady came to kill Brahma but she did not succeed in killing him.

Title: The Avenging Conscience
PlotSummary: A young man falls in love with a beautiful woman, but is prevented by his uncle from pursuing her. Tormented by visions of death and suffering, the young man kills his uncle and builds a wall to hide the body. The young man becomes sensitive to slight noises, like the tapping of a shoe or the crying of a bird, and the ghost of his uncle begins appearing to him.

Title: The Secret of Madame Blanche
PlotSummary: Sally Sanders is an American showgirl visiting London in 1898 when she marries Leonard St. John. Leonard is unable to provide a living for his new bride and himself, and eventually goes home to his father asking for help. St. Johns suggests that his son divorce his wife and keep her as a mistress, while marrying within his own class. Leonard agrees to take his son back but only if he writes to Sally ending the marriage. Leonard, seeing no alternative, agrees to send him a suicide note and shoots himself.

Title: Chalk
PlotSummary: The film takes the course of an entire school year and describes three teachers and one assistant principal. Mr. Lowrey is an introverted first-time history teacher struggling to find passion for his new profession. Coach Webb (played by Janelle Schremmer) is a female gym teacher who is struggling to get her students to take her class seriously.

Title: Hammer the Toff
PlotSummary: Richard Rollison (Bentley) is sharing a carriage with an attractive young lady called Susan Lancaster (Dainton) The journey is interrupted when the window of the carriage is shattered by a barrage of bullets. Richard learns from the shaken Susan that she is on her way to join an uncle on holiday, and offers to escort her safely to her hotel. Later, Rollison happens to overhear a pair of shady characters discussing how to kidnap Susan.

Title: She Couldn't Say No
PlotSummary: Corby Lane (Jean Simmons) visits the American hamlet of Progress, Arkansas, whose residents had paid for a critical medical operation for her when she was a child. She decides to express her gratitude by giving them money anonymously. The headstrong woman clashes with the local doctor, Robert Sellers (Robert Mitchum), who foresees the resulting chaos.

Title: Grandview, U.S.A.
PlotSummary: Tim Pearson, a soon-to-be graduate of Grandview High School, wants to go to Florida to study oceanography. Mechanic Michelle "Mike" Cody comes to Tim's defense, and has Ernie "Slam" Webster, a local demolition derby driver, tow the car, taking Tim along. The next morning, Tim goes to see his father at his office and hints to him that he does not want Tim to drive his car again. Slam gets home and sees his wife Candy with another man, Donny. Donny accidentally shoots himself in the foot in the ensuing struggle.

Title: The Green Cockatoo
PlotSummary: An innocent young girl travels to London from her home in Devon and gets mixed up with unsavoury characters. The film is based on the story of an innocent girl travelling to London to meet a group of unsavourable characters. It is set in London and is set to be shown in cinemas in London cinemas on BBC2's The London Eye.

Title: Kamen Rider Kabuto: GOD SPEED LOVE
PlotSummary: In 1999, an enormous meteor crashed onto Earth and caused a global calamity that depleted the planet's waters. The meteor carried extraterrestrial creatures known as the Worms who proceeded to kill humans and assume their identities. ZECT has obtained intelligence about a large comet orbiting the vicinity of space. By building the Jacob's Ladder space station, they plan to capture this comet and spread its water throughout Earth. By present time, power struggles in ZECT have caused Hidenori Oda to establish a splinter group called Neo-ZECT with Daisuke Kazama and Shura Hokuto to fight against ZECT's

Title: Love Khichdi
PlotSummary: Vir is a bachelor from a small town working as a sous-chef in a five-star hotel in Mumbai, India. He flirts with, yearns for and lusts after any woman who is friendly, but seems unattainable. Vir is suckered by them all - with his ego, confusion and commitment.

Title: Guilty by Suspicion
PlotSummary: De Niro returns from abroad to find that McCarthyism has led to his not being allowed to work in films. He will only be allowed to direct once he implicates colleagues as Communist agents. He must decide whether to turn informant, or to stick to principle at the cost of his life's work.

Title: Anjani Putra
PlotSummary: Viraj aka Raj aka Raj (Puneeth) is a moneylender and also the heir to the Raj Group, a cloth manufacturing conglomerate. He was disowned by his mother and uncle of his joint family Anjana Devi (Ramya Krishnan) due to some misunderstanding. He meets a rich girl Geetha (Rashmika Mandanna) at a mall, who soon falls in love with him for his good nature. Raj saves the Additional Superintendent of Police Surya Prakash(P. Ravi Shankar) and his wife from a group of thugs who work for Bhairava

Title: Margot at the Wedding
PlotSummary: Margot (Nicole Kidman) is a successful but self-absorbed writer; it is suggested that she has borderline personality disorder. She brings her 11-year-old son Claude (Zane Pais) to spend a weekend visiting her free-spirited sister Pauline (Jennifer Jason Leigh) Margot disapproves of Pauline's choice of fiancé: Malcolm is an unsuccessful musician whom Margot considers unattractive.

Title: The Cyclops
PlotSummary: Test pilot Bruce Barton (Duncan Parkin) is missing and his girlfriend, Susan Winter (Gloria Talbott) organizes a search party, sent out in the jungles of Mexico. The team of scientist Russ Bradford (James Craig), mining expert Martin "Marty" Melville (Lon Chaney Jr.) and pilot Lee Brand (Tom Drake) fly into an unknown territory. While searching the area, they uncover giant mutated earth animals such as giant snakes, lizards, behemoth bugs and oversized mammals.

Title: Cleopatra
PlotSummary: In 48 BC, Cleopatra vies with her brother Ptolemy for control of Egypt. Marc Antony and Octavian are named co-rulers of Rome. Antony invites her to meet with him in Tarsus, intending to bring her back to Rome as a captive. She entices him to her barge and throws a party with exotic animals and beautiful dancers, and soon bewitches him. She tests a poison on a condemned murderer to see how it works and kills Antony.

Title: Tu Hi Re
PlotSummary: Nandini (Sai Tamhankar) is someone who is a staunch believer in love marriages but following her father's orders, she gets married to Siddharth (Swwapnil Joshi) who is coping with heartbreak. Kamlakar Bhanushali (Girish Oak) is a politician who has some connection with Siddarth's past.

Title: The Guilt of Janet Ames
PlotSummary: Bitter war widow seeks out the five soldiers for whom her husband gave his life by falling on a hand grenade during the Battle of the Bulge. While crossing a city street to find the first, she is struck and knocked unconscious by an automobile. The police find no identification on her, only a list of names. One recognizes the last name on her list, a reporter recently fired for alcoholism, and contacts Smitty Cobb. When Smitty sees the list, he realizes who she must be and finds her in a wheelchair, unable to walk.

Title: The Big Boodle
PlotSummary: A blackjack dealer in a Havana casino is given some counterfeit peso bills by a woman. He confronts the woman with the fact they are counterfeit, but she denies it and leaves. Two thugs attack Ned on his way home, but run off when the police are summoned. He is accused of being involved in a plan to flood Cuba with worthless currency. He meets with a young woman, Anita Ferrer, who believes he has the bills and offers to buy them.

Title: Blues Harp
PlotSummary: Ambitious yakuza Kenji befriends harmonica-playing bartender Chuji, who moonlights as a part-time drug-dealer for the opposing gang. Their friendship is threatened by Kenji's plans for advancement as well as his bodyguards' growing jealousy of Chuji.

Title: Lakshyam
PlotSummary: The film starts with a flashback in Hyderabad. ACP Bose is a sincere police officer happily married and lives with his parents and younger brother Chandu (Gopichand) Chandu is a college student and he falls in love with his classmate Indu (Anushka)

Title: BASEketball
PlotSummary: Joe "Coop" Cooper and Doug Remer are 23 and unemployed when BASEketball becomes popular in their neighborhood. Five years later, the NBL is in full swing with teams, fans, stadiums, and a major championship, the Denslow Cup, hosted by Al Michaels and Bob Costas. Coop declares Remer part owner of the team, and they come to meet Jenna Reed, head of the Dream Come True Foundation, and Joey, one of the children in her care.

Title: Yatterman
PlotSummary: In Tokyoko, a fictional city sporting various homages of Tatsunoko Production works, the Doronbo Gang have seemingly destroyed a large part of the city. The heroic Yatterman duo make their entrance with Yatterwoof (Yamadera, voice), a sentient dog-shaped mecha and Toybotty (Takahashi, voice) Gan Takada and Ai Kaminari live a double life as crime-fighting heroes. They are based under Takada Toys, founded by Gan's father. The girl they found in the ruins was Shoko Kaieda, daughter of Dr

Title: Helen of Troy
PlotSummary: The film retells the story of the Trojan War in 1100 B.C., albeit with some major changes from the Iliad's storyline. Paris of Troy (Jacques Sernas) sails to Sparta to secure a peace treaty between the two powerful city-states. He is found by Helen, queen of Sparta, with whom he falls in love.

Title: The Triumph of Sherlock Holmes
PlotSummary: Holmes and Dr. Watson come out of retirement to investigate a mysterious murder. They find that an American criminal organisation called The Scowrers has asked evil mastermind Professor Moriarty to wreak vengeance on John Douglas, the informant who sent them to prison. Holmes outsmarts Moriarty, solves the murder and brings him to justice. Like all the films featuring Wontner as Holmes, this one has a contemporary setting.

Title: Rancho Deluxe
PlotSummary: Jack McKee and Cecil Colson are a couple of young, restless rustlers. They have begun rustling cattle, cutting them up with a chainsaw and paying bills with fresh meat. The rustling of his livestock lights a fire under rancher John Brown, who sends Burt and Curt up in a helicopter to try to catch the thieves in the act. Jack and Cecil continue to single out Brown's cattle, even kidnapping his $50,000 prize bull, "Basehart of Bozeman Canyon"

Title: Losin' It
PlotSummary: Four teenagers from late 1950s Los Angeles are on their way to Tijuana, Mexico. Dave, Woody, Spider, and Spider are there to lose their virginity. They end up picking up a woman named Kathy, who goes with them because she wants a fast divorce from her husband.

Title: Meet Maxwell Archer
PlotSummary: Private detective attempts to clear a young man wrongly accused of murder. Maxwell Archer is a private detective who tries to clear the wrong man. The case is set to be shown in a new series of American Horror Horror Horror Films, directed by Stephen King at 8pm on BBC One.

Title: Robin and Marian
PlotSummary: An aging Robin Hood is a trusted captain fighting for King Richard the Lionheart in France. He is mortally wounded by an arrow thrown by an old man. After Richard's death, Robin and Little John return to England and are reunited with old friends Will Scarlet and Friar Tuck in Sherwood Forest.

Title: Mogudu Kaavali
PlotSummary: Krishna (Gayatri) is inherited with lots of wealth from her father, but he imposes a condition that she should marry in order to inherit that wealth. Krishna doesn’t want to marry a prince who might later turn out to be a toad. So, she hires Chiru as her hire husband and tries to get all her father’s wealth.

Title: Michael and Mary
PlotSummary: Young bride (Edna Best) is deserted by her husband but finds happiness with another man. They contract a bigamous marriage for the sake of their child (Frank Lawton) The first husband turns up and starts black-mailing them. During a quarrel with the second husband, he dies. After some complications, their son learns the truth, but stands by them.

Title: Intimate Confessions Of A Chinese Courtesan
PlotSummary: The Shaw Brothers classic is regarded as one of the most outrageous and taboo-smashing Shaw Brothers classics. Young Ai Nu is abducted and sold to the Four Seasons brothel run by lusty madam Chun Yi. Soon murder erupts within the brothel, and a policeman must race against time to prevent a vicious revenge plot from reaching its blood-spattered conclusion.

Title: Predators
PlotSummary: Royce awakens to find himself parachuting into an unfamiliar jungle. He meets several others who arrived in the same manner. They find themselves staring at an alien sky and realize they are not on Earth. Royce deduces they are on a planet used as a game preserve, where humans are hunted as game.

Title: The Interpreter
PlotSummary: Silvia Broome (Nicole Kidman) is an interpreter working at the United Nations in New York City. She was born in the USA and spent most of her life in Africa (the Republic of Matobo, a fictional African country) and Europe. The U.N. is considering indicting Edmond Zuwanie (Earl Cameron), Matobo's president, to stand trial in the International Criminal Court. Over the past 20 years he has become as corrupt and tyrannical as the government he overthrew.

Title: Three to Go
PlotSummary: Young people and their personal concerns are the main theme of the segments. Judy, a 19-year-old country girl wants to go to the big city, leaving her country town behind. A young man, Michael, faces a choice between his wealthy middle class parents and their middle class wealthy lifestyle and a group of radicals. In it, a young Greek woman falls for an Australian man despite the opposition of her conservative Greek parents and family.

Title: Sandook
PlotSummary: Sandook is a satirical comic thriller set in pre independence era in a small town called Sambalgarh. The protagonist Vamanrao Ashtaputre is a simple honest man who always dreams of getting rid of the British Raj. How the underdog that is the underdog. becomes a revolutionary albeit accidentally is the core story of Sandook.

Title: The Trouble with Harry
PlotSummary: The body of Harry Worp (Philip Truex) has appeared on the hillside above the town of Highwater, Vermont. The town's residents bury the body and then dig it up again several times throughout the day. Finally it is learned that Harry died of natural causes; no foul play at all was involved. In the meantime, Sam and Jennifer have fallen in love and wish to marry.

Title: Speak
PlotSummary: Melinda Sordino begins her freshman year in high school and struggles on the first day. She is made fun of by several students, repeatedly called a "squealer" A series of flashbacks reveal that she called the police to a house party during the previous summer. Her actual reason for calling 9-1-1 was that she'd been raped by a senior student at the party.

Title: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire
PlotSummary: Harry Potter awakens from a nightmare wherein Frank Bryce is killed after overhearing Lord Voldemort conspiring with Peter Pettigrew and another man. Albus Dumbledore introduces ex-Auror Alastor "Mad-Eye" Moody as the new Defence Against the Dark Arts teacher. The Goblet of Fire selects "champions" to take part in the competition: Cedric Diggory of Hufflepuff representing Hogwarts, Viktor Krum representing the Durmstrang Institute from Central Europe, Fleur Delacour representing Beauxbatons Academy of Magic from France. Harry comes out in third place, but is placed second

Title: Black Water Vampire
PlotSummary: Every ten years for the last forty years, a woman's body is discovered in the woods outside of Black Water, drained of blood and bearing mysterious bite marks. Raymond Banks (Bill Oberst Jr.) has been convicted of the crime, but Danielle (Danielle Lozeau) doesn't believe that he's the murderer. Danielle convinces her friends Andrea (Andrea Monier) and Rob (Robin Steffen) to venture out into the woods to search for evidence. They hire Anthony (Anthony Fanelli) to film their search, which quickly turns bizarre when they begin hearing stories about supernatural creatures, as well as being

Title: The Miracle of Our Lady of Fatima
PlotSummary: Portugal is feeling the after-effects of a storm of anti-religious sentiment and the violent overthrow of the monarchy and the government in the 5 October 1910 revolution. The rural town of Fátima is small enough to have escaped much of this persecution; their church remains open, and most of the people are reasonably devout. Lúcia Santos (Susan Whitney) and her cousins, Jacinta Marto, and Francisco Marto (Sammy Ogg) run into an unusual "cloud of light" surrounding a little tree on which a mysterious lady stands. The Lady asks them to return on the 13th of each

Title: The Alligator People
PlotSummary: Joyce Webster has just married a young man named Paul Webster (Richard Crane) Aboard their honeymoon train, Paul receives a telegram and, in a panic, immediately leaves the train to make a phone call. Joyce takes the next train to the desolate whistle-stop town of Bayou Landing in the heart of Louisiana swamp country. Joyce introduces herself to Lavinia Hawthorne (Frieda Inescort), the Cypresses' stern mistress. The next morning, Mark Sinclair (George Macready) operates a clinic on the plantation, a self-proclaimed "Swamp Doctor"

Title: Zaalim
PlotSummary: Judge Somnath had wanted his sons to be a doctor, police officer and a Judge. Ravi is prone to losing his temper, and has killed someone in his childhood. When Kaamna gets raped, the family is reluctant to tell Ravi about the rape of his daughter.

Title: Powder
PlotSummary: Jeremy Reed is an albino young man who has incredible intellect and is able to sense the thoughts of the people around him. Jeremy's brain possesses a powerful electromagnetic charge, which causes electrical objects to function abnormally when he is around them, particularly when he becomes emotional. He is taken from his home when his grandfather is found dead of natural causes.

Title: Reno 911!: Miami
PlotSummary: The film opens outside of a building where terrorists are holding hostages and a nuclear bomb. The Reno Sheriff's Department arrives in a helicopter, called in as experts. The team assume the Miami Sheriff's responsibilities, and respond to several emergency calls including an alligator in a swimming pool and street prostitution that leads to Reno.

Title: 92 Legendary La Rose Noire
PlotSummary: Children's novel writer Butterfly Wong (Maggie Shiu) is unsuccessful in her career and relationship. Butterfly imitates Black Rose, a vigilante character who appeared in 1960s Hong Kong films. As a result, The real Black Rose's apprentices, Piu-hung (Fung Bo Bo) and Yim-fan (Wong Wan-sze) kidnap Butterfly. Detective Keith Lui (Tony Leung) has a crush on Butterfly.

Title: Never Back Down
PlotSummary: Jake Tyler (Sean Faris) has recently moved from Iowa to Orlando, Florida with his mother, Margret (Leslie Hope), and younger brother, Charlie (Wyatt Smith), to support Charlie's shot at a professional tennis career. Jake was a star athlete on the football team at home, but in this new city, he is an outsider with a reputation for being a quick tempered brawler. A video of him starting a fight at one of his football games after a frustrated player taunted Jake about his father, who died in a drunk driving accident, circulates around his new school. A classmate, Max

Title: Josettante Hero (ജോസേട്ടന്റെ ഹീറോ)
PlotSummary: Vijayaraghavan appears as the title character of Josettan, who is a senior film producer. Anoop Menon comes up as Saajan Malyath, the still photographer of the film who is accidentally selected to become the hero of the new film in production.

Title: Holiday
PlotSummary: Muskaan (Onjolee Nair) is a shy, wealthy girl who visits Goa with her family. She meets Dino (Dino Morea), a dance performer at the holiday resort in Goa. His dance partner, Alysha (Kashmira Shah), is betrayed by a man who impregnates her. As Dino helps her train, love begins to bloom between them and problems arise.

Title: Rupaye Dus Karod
PlotSummary: Chamanlal and Aatmaram were partners with Jamuna Das and Babubhai, but when Atmaram discovers that the core business is selling women abroad for prostitution, he breaks away from this partnership. His wife leaves the house along with her son and clothes to start a living on her own. Aarthi Saxena has huge crush on Ravi Varma all because of his suspense novels. Ravi agrees to work for them, but at the same time devises scheme to save his mother from unscrupulous people.

Title: The Boudoir Diplomat
PlotSummary: Ian Keith plays a French military attaché in Madrid who romantically pursues the wives of various government officials. Betty Compson and Mary Duncan play the objects of his attention. The film is based on a novel by Robert De Niro and is set on BBC2.

Title: The Riddle
PlotSummary: A woman is murdered following her discovery of an unpublished Charles Dickens manuscript. The three are Mike (Jones), an ambitious sports tabloid journalist, Kate (Cox), a police officer, and an eccentric old beach-combing tramp (Jacobi) Together they must track down the mystery and solve the riddle of the manuscript.

Title: Escape Me Never
PlotSummary: The story takes place in Venice at the turn of the 20th century. A young composer by the name of Caryl Dubrok has a love affair with a wealthy English heiress, Fenella MacLean, until her parents by mistake start believing that Caryl is living with young widow Gemma Smith and her infant baby. It turns out that Gemma is really living with Caryls big brother Sebastian, who showed pity of the young lonely mother and let her stay with him. Sebastian is unaware that it is Fenella he has met in the street, and starts pursuing her.

Title: Second Chorus
PlotSummary: Danny O'Neill (Fred Astaire), and Hank Taylor (Burgess Meredith) are friends and rival trumpeters with "O'Neill's Perennials," a college band. Artie Shaw, playing himself, comes to woo Ellen away to be his booking manager. She tries to get Danny and Hank an audition for Shaw's band, but their jealous hi-jinks get them fired. Ellen talks Shaw into letting rich wannabee musician J. Lester Chisholm back a concert.

Title: First Offenders
PlotSummary: District Attorney resigns from his position in order to open establish a farm that gives juvenile delinquents and first-offenders a place to straighten out their lives before they reach the point of no return. He meets much resistance from various segments of the law and the citizens.

Title: Kodama Simham
PlotSummary: Bharath (Chiranjeevi) is a rough and tough cowboy with a heart of gold. His parents are fatally attacked by the villains when he spoils their gambling and prostitution operations. His dying father tells him that he was adopted and told him to look in another city for his real parents.

Title: Mexican Hayride
PlotSummary: Joe Bascomb (Lou Costello) chases con man Harry Lambert (Bud Abbott) to Mexico City, after Harry apparently swindled him (and some friends) in an oil stock scam back in the United States. Joe is persuaded to participate in Harry's, Dagmar's (Luba Malina) and Mary's plan to sell fake silver mine stock. While giving tours of the bogus mine, Joe extols its beauty and sells stock to anyone he can. Eventually the authorities track down and incarcerate Joe, along with Harry, but Joe manages to escape.

Title: Government Girl
PlotSummary: Automobile engineer Ed Browne (Sonny Tufts) comes to Washington to appear in front of the War Construction Board. His mission is to supervise the building of bomber aircraft for the war. Ed is unaware that the same room is reserved by Elizabeth "Smokey" Allard (Olivia de Havilland), for her friend May (Anne Shirley) who is getting married to an army sergeant, Joe Bates, that very night. The groom has lost his ring, and Smokey borrows one from Ed, which leads him to believe that Smokey is the woman getting married. Smokey learns that she

Title: Murder 3
PlotSummary: The film opens with Vikram (Randeep Hooda, a hot-shot fashion and wildlife photographer, viewing a video of his girlfriend, Roshni (Aditi Rao Hydari) telling him she is leaving him. Vikram becomes a suspect in the disappearance of his girlfriend Roshni. Nisha (Sara Loren) finds the key to the secret room, but she doesn't know what it is used for.

Title: They Won't Forget
PlotSummary: A southern town is rocked by scandal when teenager Mary Clay is murdered on Confederate Memorial Day. A district attorney with political ambitions sees the crime as way to the Senate if he can find the right scapegoat to be tried for the crime. Robert Hale, Mary's teacher at the business school where she was killed, is convicted and sentenced to death. The issue moves from innocence or guilt to the continuing bigotry and suspicion between South and North.

Title: Pichaikkaran
PlotSummary: Arul Selvakumar (Vijay Antony) is a rich businessman based out of Palladam, Tirupur district. His mother Bhuvaneshwari (Dheepa Ramanujam) is the person behind the growth of their textile business following her husband’s early death. Arul meets a Swamiji who suggests that Arul should lead a life of a beggar for 48 days and this would help his mother to recover. He meets Magizhini (Satna Titus) and develops affection seeing her good nature.

Title: Chidambarathil Oru Appasamy
PlotSummary: Elangovan (Thankar Bachchan) is a school teacher in Chidambaram who is a jack of all trades but master of none. He spends time with friends boozing, gambling and trying out new business that always fails. Fearing his wife and relatives he decides to join a mutt but there also he is unable to sustain.

Title: The Quiet Man
PlotSummary: In the 1920s, Sean Thornton travels to Ireland to reclaim his family's farm and his birthplace in Inisfree. He meets and falls in love with the fiery Mary Kate Danaher, the sister of the bullying, loud-mouthed landowner Squire "Red" Will Danaher (Victor McLaglen) Danaher is angry that the Widow Tillane (Mildred Natwick) accepts Sean's bid, and retaliates by refusing consent for his sister to marry him. After learning the truth on Sean and Mary Kate's wedding day, an enraged Will refuses to give his sister her dowry.

Title: Daring Danger
PlotSummary: Tim Madigan (Tim McCoy) is a cowboy coming to the aid of Gerry Norris (Alberta Vaughn), whose father (Murdock MacQuarrie) is in trouble with a gang of cattle rustlers. The leaders of the rustlers prove to be the very same villains Madigan was trailing.

Title: Night of Fear
PlotSummary: A young woman crashes her car on a lonely country road and is terrorised by a crazed hermit. Hermit terrorises the young woman and terrorises her with her car. The film is based on the story of a young woman being chased by a crazy hermit in the country.

Title: Homicide
PlotSummary: Bobby Gold is a homicide detective on the trail of Robert Randolph, a drug-dealer and cop-killer on the FBI's Ten Most Wanted List. The elderly Jewish owner of a candy store in a ghetto has been gunned down, reportedly for a fortune hidden in her basement. Gold is thrust into a series of circumstances that test his loyalty to the badge, but also his newfound Jewish consciousness.

Title: Adhurs
PlotSummary: The story is about two twin brothers who get separated at birth. They were separated by an old woman whose daughter-in-law gave birth to a dead child for the third time. Narasimha (NTR Jr.) gets raised by a single mother (Vinaya Prasad) and he becomes an undercover agent to a top cop(Sayaji Shinde)

Title: Kanave Kalaiyadhe
PlotSummary: Anand (Murali) and Amrita (Simran) are lovers. Anand is a Tamilian who is unable to bear separation from Amriti and her family. Shear (Sharada) is Sharada's look-alike and Anand falls in love with her.

Title: Millionaire's Express
PlotSummary: Ching Fong-Tin (Sammo Hung) goes to Russia to steal goods from the Russian soldiers. He is made to wear a brassiere and the head of a mop as a wig. Bandits dressed in police uniforms set fire to a large building. While the fire rages, the bandits rob the town bank, but the manager manages to alert the townfolk before they can escape and two of the bandits are jailed. As the train travels through the country, passenger Han sneaks back and forth on roof of the train between his fat wife and his beautiful mistress.

Title: Vaanga Partner Vaanga
PlotSummary: Ponnappan (Radha Ravi) and Azhagappan are three naive villagers who come to Chennai for becoming wealthy. They decide to join hands and they begin to look for an intelligent, bachelor and good partner. They then sign a contract with the lord (statue) in five years time, Ganapathi will have the quarter of their benefit. Five years later, Ponnapan, Uzhagappans become wealthy and arrogant men. One day, the Gurukkal asks them to build a temple but they refuse it.

Title: Lost and Delirious
PlotSummary: Mary is a new student at the all girls' boarding school, and dorms with Paulie and Victoria. Mary observes the intimacy between her two dormmates. Mary sees them kissing on a roof. Paulie degenerates into psychotic abusive behavior, like destroying a mirror and thrashing a dish cart to the floor.

Title: Blinky Bill the Movie
PlotSummary: A courageous young koala called Blinky Bill tells a story about his father, Bill Koala, while embarking on a journey across the wild and dangerous Australian outback. Blinky’s dad had created their home Green Patch, where every animal could feel safe and live in peace. Throughout his adventure he befriends a girl koala named Nutsy, a lizard named Jacko and a few other creatures.

Title: Ghost Ship
PlotSummary: In 1962, aboard the Italian ocean liner SS Antonia Graza, dozens of wealthy passengers dance to the song "Senza Fine" sung by Francesca, an Italian lounge singer. Forty years later, at a bar, a boat salvage crew — Captain Sean Murphy, Maureen Epps, Greer, Dodge, Munder, and Santos — celebrate their recent success. As they prepare to tow it, they discover it contains a large quantity of gold. After a series of supernatural events, the group decides to abandon the salvage effort but take the gold, but an invisible force sabotages the Arctic Warrior. The group

Title: Dark Delusion
PlotSummary: Dr. Tommy Coalt is asked to sign mental-health commitment papers on a beautiful socialite, Cynthia Grace. Coalt thinks there is something amiss, and begins his own investigation. The film is set in the small town of Bayhurst, a small town in post-World War II Europe.

Title: Nazrana
PlotSummary: Raj (Raj Kapoor) and Vasanti (Vyjayanthimala) are college mates who clash when she complains to the college principal about a love letter he sent her. The two fall in love when Raj falls ill and in nursing him, Geeta falls in love with him. Raj initially neglects Geeta and the two have a son. Geeta dies in guilt leaving Raj alone to bring up their child.

Title: My Big Father
PlotSummary: The film is based on a recommendation letter from a teashop owner played by Innocent. By the time the credits end, the business has turned around and the infant has grown up. The boy grows up to be a strapping young man Alby, dancing on the beaches of Goa with his father.

Title: Set It Off
PlotSummary: Francesca "Frankie" Sutton is a Los Angeles bank teller who witnesses a robbery. She is fired after the police uncover a connection between her and one of the three robbers. The four women embark on a series of bank robberies, which are investigated by LAPD detective Strode.

Title: The Sagebrush Troubadour
PlotSummary: Texas Rangers Gene Autry (Gene Autry) and Frog Millhouse (Smiley Burnette) are traveling undercover as western troubadours in search of the killer of Frank Martin. Their only clues are a guitar string (the murder weapon) and Martin's horse Swayback that hold the key to finding the dead man's lost goldmine. Gene and Frog escape a trap set for them at the dance and save Joan when she is nearly strangled by another guitar string.

Title: The Proud and Profane
PlotSummary: The widow of a Paramarine lieutenant killed on the Battle of Bloody Ridge on Guadalcanal has joined the American Red Cross on the island to entertain American servicemen. A Marine Raider battalion comes to New Caledonia after fighting in the South Pacific. Lieutenant Colonel Black (William Holden) objects to the Red Cross women treating his men softly; he states that the only place for women in war are "skirts" that the men chase and the "sweethearts" that wait for them back home.

Title: Two on a Guillotine
PlotSummary: John Harley Duquesne is a psychotic magician who accidentally beheads his wife Melinda with a guillotine during a performance. Twenty years later he dies, his will requires his daughter Cassie (the mirror image of her mother) to spend seven nights in his apparently haunted mansion in order to inherit his estate.

Title: Indiana Jones and the Kingdom of the Crystal Skull
PlotSummary: Indiana Jones and his partner George "Mac" McHale are kidnapped by Soviet agents in 1957. They force Jones to locate a mummified corpse recovered from a crash site. After a fight with Spalko's sadistic henchman, Jones escapes to a model town at the Nevada Test Site minutes before atomic bomb test. Jones is rescued, decontaminated, and apprehended by FBI agents, who suspect him of working for the Soviets.

Title: Springtime for Henry
PlotSummary: Henry Dewlip is the heir to his late father's prosperous automobile plant. He lets underlings run things while he indulges in wine, women and song. Julia Jelliwell is the latest woman to have the key to his apartment. Also the strait-laced Miss Smith, his latest secretary who secretly harbours a crush on him.

Title: Barfly
PlotSummary: Henry Chinaski (Mickey Rourke) is a destitute alcoholic who lives in a rundown apartment and works menial jobs when he can find them. At night, he drinks, hangs out with other down and out alcoholics, and eventually gets into altercations with the tough guy bartender he hates. In the meantime, Henry is tracked down by a wealthy female book publisher, Tully Sorenson, who has been impressed with his writing and is interested in publishing some of his work. The film ends with Henry buying all of his "friends" at the bar.

Title: CID Shankar
PlotSummary: C. I. D. Shankar and his assistant Raju is deputed to the Nilgiris to investigate a case of mysterious murder. The film had in its title sequence in which a politician is killed by a suicide bomber who explodes her explosive belt. Shankar discovers to the murder are being, committed by a terrorist gang, who are embarking on a secret movement.

Title: A Clockwork Orange
PlotSummary: Alex DeLarge is the leader of a gang of "droogs", Georgie, Dim and Pete. He rapes his wife while singing "Singin' in the Rain" He is sentenced to 14 years in prison for being a test subject to an experimental aversion therapy. Two years into the sentence, Alex is forced to watch films of sex and violence with his eyes forced open. He is unable to withstand the sickening pain and attempts suicide by throwing himself out the window.

Title: Assassination Classroom: Graduation
PlotSummary: Class 3-E of Kunugigaoka High School has not been able to assassinate their teacher, Koro-sensei, who will blow up the Earth on graduation day. Neither the students nor the government-sponsored assassin Red Eye are ultimately able to do the task. Nagisa Shiota decides to find an alternative besides killing Koro Sensei after hearing the story.

Title: 8 Thottakkal
PlotSummary: The film stars an orphaned boy, Sathya, getting framed by the employer for the murder of his wife and is sent to juvenile. Unlike the other policemen at his station, he refuses to be involved in bribes and is made an outcast. One day he helps a writer who is beaten by his corrupt inspector, Gunasekaran. The inspector arranges for Sathiya to shadow a dangerous gangster. While shadowing the gangster, he loses his gun fully loaded with 8 bullets or face disciplinary action. He nabs the boy who pickpocketed his gun but the boy has sold the gun.

Title: Cabin in the Sky
PlotSummary: Little Joe, a man killed over gambling debts, is restored to life by angelic powers. He is given six months to redeem his soul and become worthy of entering Heaven. Little Joe abandons his wife for Georgia Brown, and the two embark on a life of hedonistic pleasure.

Title: Rings
PlotSummary: Julia sees her boyfriend Holt off to college but grows concerned when he falls out of contact. She is inspired to find him when a panicked girl, Skye, contacts her, asking for his whereabouts. She locks herself in the bathroom as Samara kills Skye. The group film themselves watching the video before passing the footage to another person, called a "tail"

Title: Boxing Helena
PlotSummary: Nick Cavanaugh is a lonely Atlanta surgeon obsessed with Helena. After she suffers a high grade tibial fracture in a hit-and-run motor vehicle accident, he kidnaps and treats her in his house surreptitiously. He amputates her arms above the elbow after she tries to choke him.

Title: Jade Goddess of Mercy
PlotSummary: Yang Rui is a handsome Beijing executive who is bored with his easy life and numerous female conquests. He hears about a woman named He Yanhong who is from out of town, beautiful but mysterious and reclusive. When she kicks him in the head after coming on too strongly, she shows some regret and compassion, nursing him back to health and they develop a friendship. Unfortunately, Yang's scorned female boss becomes jealous, reveals she has been spying on the young couple, reveals that she has a child, and then frames him for accepting an illegal kickback.

Title: The World of Henry Orient
PlotSummary: In early 1960s New York City, concert pianist Henry Orient (Peter Sellers) pursues an affair with a married woman. Two adolescent private-school girls, Valerie "Val" Boyd (Tippy Walker) and Marian "Gil" Gilbert (Merrie Spaeth) stalk him and write their fantasies about him in a diary. In reality, Val, the bright and imaginative daughter of wealthy international trade expert Frank Boyd (Tom Bosley) and his unfaithful, snobbish wife Isabel (Angela Lansbury) has developed a teenage crush on Henry.

Title: CBGB
PlotSummary: In 1970s New York City, Hilly Kristal is divorced and has filed bankruptcy for the second time. With his business partner Merv Ferguson, Kristal convinces his mother to loan them the money needed to establish the dive bar CBGB. CBGB soon becomes a rock venue that caters to the burgeoning punk movement. Kristal's daughter, Lisa, attempts to take over the chaotic finances in an attempt to save the business. The epilogue reveals that CBGB remained opened until 2006.

Title: Nuns on the Run
PlotSummary: London gangsters Brian Hope (Idle) and Charlie McManus (Coltrane) desire to lead more peaceful lives in Brazil. While planning to rob a local Triad gang of their ill-gotten drug money, Brian meets and falls in love with a waitress, Faith. During the robbery, Brian and Charlie betray their crew, steal the money and flee, but are forced to abandon their car when it runs out of petrol and seek refuge in a nearby nunnery during the ensuing gunfight. Faith, who had tried to warn Brian beforehand, is shot in the wrist, while one of the triads is shot

Title: Muni
PlotSummary: Muniyaandi (Rajkiran) was a kind-hearted poor man living in the slums with his daughter and other people. Muni's friend is Marakka Dhandapaani MLA (Kadhal Dhandapani) who uses Muni to make him win in elections and promises to give lands to the poor villagers. Dhandapani wins the election but he cheats Muni and kills both him and his daughter.

Title: Kick 2
PlotSummary: Robin Hood (Ravi Teja) is Kalyan Krishna's son and despite his father saying, Robin looks for "comfort" more than Kick. Robin became a doctor so that if he gets injured, he can treat himself immediately. Robin is persuaded by a writer, Chaitra (Rakul Preet Singh), who wants to write his story, to stay in love with him. Villagers in Bihar expect Robin to arrive soon to save them from an evil man, Solomon Singh Thakur. Robin finally realizes the value of his father's "kick"

Title: Arpeggio of Blue Steel
PlotSummary: Due to global warming and rising sea levels in the early 21st century, much of Earth's landmass has been lost. In 2039, fleets of powerful sentient warships, armed with advanced technology and possibly 'alien' weaponry, mysteriously appear and devastate the world's naval forces. The Fleet of Fog impose a worldwide naval and aerial blockade, preventing humanity from traveling the oceans and to other nations. Gunzō Chihaya, a former student of the Japanese National Marine Academy, is the captain of a small group of privateers called the 'Blue Steel' The Blue Steel are infamous for possessing a Fog submarine, the

Title: V. I. P
PlotSummary: Guru (Prabhu Deva) is a graduate but cannot find a job because employers are looking experience. Anupam Kher is a rich businessman but his business is about to topple when he invites his nephew Santhosh (Abbas) from the US to save it from loss. Priya (Simran) is his daughter and she expects to marry him. Meanwhile Guru steals a car from a businessman who refused to employ him and when the goondas chase, he and Indhu enter into the airport.

Title: Mikey and Nicky
PlotSummary: Nicky (John Cassavetes) calls Mikey (Peter Falk) yet again to bail him out of trouble. Mikey gets Nicky out of the hotel where he has holed up, and starts to help him plan his escape. The two friends have to confront issues of betrayal, regret, and the value of friendship versus self-preservation.

Title: The Honeymoon Machine
PlotSummary: Jason Eldridge (Hutton) runs Magnetic Analyzer Computing Synchrotron (MACS), a vacuum-tube computer aboard the USS Elmira. Eldridge, Lt. Ferguson Howard (McQueen) and LTJG Beauregard Gilliam (Mullaney) check into a Venice casino's hotel dressed as civilians with Eldridge. The gambling system is very effective, and the three men accumulate hundreds of thousands of dollars in casino chips. However, Admiral Fitch sees and investigates their signals; soon the Navy, the American and Soviet consulates, and Venice city authorities are on alert for a "revolution

Title: Thalaimagan
PlotSummary: The story is set around the bulwark of honest and public good institution of everest. It is helmed by the fearless Ayya (Vijayakumar) It has among its ranks an intrepid scribe Dheeran (Sarath Kumar)

Title: Cross-Country Romance
PlotSummary: Diane North stows away in the trailer of a bacteriologist Dr. Lawrence "Larry" Smith to escape from her own wedding. Diane tells him she is poverty-stricken Maggie "Jonesy" Jones, making her way to a slightly less poor uncle. Larry tries to get rid of his passenger at every opportunity, but she falls in love.

Title: Walking with the Enemy
PlotSummary: Walking with the Enemy was inspired by true events in Hungary. The film stars two young men who work for a Jewish radio repair shop in Budapest. They save thousands of Jewish families by redirecting them to safe houses. The movie leaps ahead thirteen years, to 1957, when Elek has emigrated to New York City.

Title: Asuravithu (അസുരവിത്ത്‌)
PlotSummary: Don Bosco is a soft-spoken and religious young man who is studying in a seminary. He takes upon himself the task of bringing to heel the Pathaam Kalam gang, who killed his father years ago. Don meets head on with the Cochin underworld kings and rechristens himself as Don Daveed.

Title: A Nightmare on Elm Street 3: Dream Warriors
PlotSummary: Kristen Parker is a young girl who dreams herself into an abandoned house in Elm Street where she is chased by serial killer Freddy Krueger. Kristen is eventually calmed by intern therapist Nancy Thompson who recites part of Freddy's nursery rhyme. Kristen reveals she has had the ability to pull people into her dreams since she was a little girl.

Title: Karuvelam Pookkal
PlotSummary: Karuvelam Pookkal is a graphic picture of the abject misery of the rural poor. The story of Nallamuthu (Nasser), his wife Vadivu (Radhika) and their three children. Nasser as the cynical father, who does not wish to get his daughter married because he does not want to forgo the income. Radhika's is another sterling portrayal.

Title: A Lady to Love
PlotSummary: Tony advertises for a young wife, passing off a photograph of his hired man, Buck, as himself. Lena, a San Francisco waitress, takes up the offer, and though she is disillusioned upon discovering the truth, she goes through with the marriage because of her desire to have a home.

Title: Edge of the City
PlotSummary: Axel Nordmann (John Cassavetes) arrives at the waterfront on the west side of Manhattan, seeking employment as a longshoreman. He goes to work in a gang of stevedores headed by Charlie Malick (Jack Warden) and is befriended by Tommy Tyler (Sidney Poitier), who also supervises a stevedore gang. Tommy serves as a mentor to Axel, urging him to stand up to Malick, and that if he does he will be "ten feet tall" Axel strangles Malick unconscious and drags him away to face justice.

Title: Emma
PlotSummary: Inventor Frederick Smith's wife dies during the birth of their fourth baby, Ronnie, leaving the family in the care of their faithful housekeeper Emma. The other Smith children, Bill, Gypsy and Isabelle, have all grown into spoiled adults, but Emma lovingly indulges them all, making excuses for their bad behavior to their father and everyone else. Ronnie is happy for the Smith family, but the other children are embarrassed by the blot on their social record. Ronnie flies East to help Emma but is killed while flying through a dangerous storm.

Title: Barricade
PlotSummary: Barricade tells the story of Terence Shade, a psychologist who doesn't have enough time in the day to spend with his kids. His wife wants them all to go to her old family cabin to give the kids a white Christmas. Once there, strange noises and shadows begin to terrorize the family.

Title: Nixon
PlotSummary: The movie begins in 1972 with the White House Plumbers breaking into The Watergate and subsequently getting arrested. Eighteen months later in December 1973, Richard Nixon's Chief of Staff, Alexander Haig, brings Nixon audio tapes for Nixon to listen. The film covers most aspects of Nixon's life and political career and implies that Nixon and his wife abused alcohol and prescription medications.

Title: To Sir, with Love
PlotSummary: Mark Thackeray (Sidney Poitier) is an unemployed man. He is awarded a teaching position at North Quay Secondary School in the tough East End of London. The pupils live up to their reputation, leading him to lose his temper. The headmaster advises him that he feels "the adult approach" has failed; future class outings are cancelled.

Title: Aamar Aami
PlotSummary: The story follows with a series of incidents that affects the lives of Subroto, Sumita, Anirban, Soumya and Chandrima with arising inner conflicts and dilemmas and finally discovering of true desires and inner selves. The film stars Arunima Ghosh, Jhilik Bhattacharjee and Indrasish Roy.

Title: Rule No. 1
PlotSummary: Police sergeant Lee Kwok-keung shot and killed serial killer Chan Fuk-loi, a serial killer, after Chan crippled his four limbs. When Lee woke up in hospital 49 days later, the police refused to recognise his testimony because it contained information about the supernatural. His superior transferred him to the Miscellaneous Affairs Department so that he would be on light duty.

Title: The Diamond
PlotSummary: American Treasury Agent Joe Dennison pursues their trail to London. With the assistance of a Scotland Yard detective, he attempts to break a racket involving the production of synthetic diamonds. The film follows the heist of a heist to acquire freshly minted dollars in the U.S.

Title: Mercury Pookkal
PlotSummary: Both the youngsters try to resist marriage but are compelled to agree in the end. Meera Jasmine is from a rural landlord's family and is doing her B.Com in Trichy. Her father Mahadevan fear that she might bring disrepute to the family name.

Title: Gallowwalkers
PlotSummary: Aman (Wesley Snipes) goes after a group of outlaws kill his lover and kills them. When he is killed himself, his mother, a nun, breaks her covenant with God to save his life. His curse brings his victims back to life, and as undead, they pursue him endlessly for revenge. Aman enlists Fabulos (Riley Smith) to fight by his side against his undead victims.

Title: The Hit
PlotSummary: Willie Parker (Terence Stamp) gives evidence against his criminal compatriots in return for a very generous offer from the police. Ten years later, Parker lives in comfortable retirement in Spain until four Spanish youths kidnap him and deliver him to two hit men hired by the kingpin that Parker helped put away. Parker intentionally reveals his identity to Harry, forcing the hit men to kidnap Maggie and kill Harry.

Title: My Brother the Devil
PlotSummary: Mo (Fady Elsayed) and Rashid "Rash" (James Floyd) are teenage brothers of Egyptian descent living with their parents in Hackney. Elder brother Rash is fiercely protective of Mo, giving him a TV when he does well and encouraging him to stay in school. However Mo begins to want to emulate Rash who works as a low level drug dealer. Mo is robbed by rival gang members while trying to do a drop-off for his brother.

Title: Salaakhen
PlotSummary: Sachidanand Agnihotri is an honest school-teacher, who has always faced problems due to his honesty. He has come forward to testify against the sexual assault and murder of a young woman from Worli. He points an accusing finger at Nagesh, the son of prominent and influential Jaspal Rana. On the day of the testimony, his lawyer, Ashok Pradhan, confuses him to such an extent that he kills himself.

Title: Good-Time Girl
PlotSummary: Gwen Rawlings was a teenage girl who continually fell into the wrong crowd. Gwen's first troubles began with her employer who caught her "borrowing" a brooch from his pawnshop. The next day Gwen packed her things and moved into a boarding house. She met Jimmy, a sharp-dressed man who immediately took a liking to her. Jimmy found her a job at the Blue Angel Nightclub where she was employed as a hat-check girl. While working, she met Red, a bandmember for the club who felt the need to look after her well-being. Jimmy attempted to pursue G

Title: Kaazhcha
PlotSummary: Madhavan (Mammootty) comes across a six-year-old boy displaced from his native Gujarat and separated from his family after the devastating earthquake. He takes the boy home and cares for him, just like a son. Later finds out that legally he cannot adopt the boy.

Title: That Kind of Woman
PlotSummary: The film is set in New York City in June 1944, during World War II. Kay is a sophisticated Italian woman, the mistress of a Manhattan millionaire industrialist. She and her friend Jane meet a considerably younger American paratrooper named Red and his sergeant George Kelly. Eventually the woman finds herself torn between her upscale life in a Sutton Place apartment and the prospect of true love with the GI.

Title: Peter's Friends
PlotSummary: Peter's friends are Andrew (Branagh) and married jingle writers Roger (Laurie) and Mary (Staunton) Peter's father has recently died, and Peter plans to sell the house after this last party. Carol (Rudner) leaves Andrew and Carol, and after a year of sobriety Andrew returns to the bottle.

Title: Topaze
PlotSummary: Prof. Auguste A. Topaze is an honest, naive chemist and schoolteacher at the Stegg Academy in Paris. He loses his job when he refuses to accede to a demand by the Baroness de La Tour-La Tour to alter the grades of her bratty son, Charlemagne. After meeting and listening to the sincere remarks of Topaze, the baron, head of the La Tour Chemical Works, decides to employ him as a scientific front for his phony curative water.

Title: The Reckoning
PlotSummary: In 1380 England, the priest Nicholas (Bettany) flees his village when found in flagrante delicto with a married woman. During flight he witnesses a group that has euthanized a member to give relief from his recurring internal pain. He becomes known to the group and is captured by a travelling acting troupe who think he is a robber. Reluctantly, they allow him to join their troupe to replace the member killed. The troupe perform a biblical passion play, but, as told by the group's leader Martin (Willem Dafoe), so few attend they are unable

Title: Jaal
PlotSummary: Shankar Verma lives a poor lifestyle with his mom, Shanti, in India after his father, Satyapal leaves the family for a courtesan by the name of Meenabai. Shankar is hired by a wealthy woman named Amita who wants him to spy on Bhanu Pratap, his sons, Balram and Jackie, and his partner, Kedar.

Title: Chidambara Rahasiyam
PlotSummary: Chidambaram (S. Ve. Shekher), a good-hearted simpleton from a rich family in Karaikudi is in love with his cousin Uma (Ilavarasi) He is wrongly accused of burglary at a house, and murder of a dancer Aasha (Disco Shanthi) The impossibility of him having committed all three crimes gives him the benefit of doubt by the police, who seek the assistance of CID Beemarao.

Title: Independence Day
PlotSummary: Mary Ann Taylor's true love is photography. When Jack Parker returns to Mercury, New Mexico, he tells her he's been to the big city and happiness there is as elusive as anyplace else. Their bliss is interrupted by the discovery that Jack's meek sister is being physically abused by her husband.

Title: Traveling Saleslady
PlotSummary: Angela Twitchell (Joan Blondell) wants to work for her father's New York company. Her father is convinced that women have no place in the business. Rufus is losing sales to rival company own by Schmidts (Al Shean) But Angela tries to help her father by bringing an idea for a cocktail flavored toothpaste.

Title: Ananda Tandavam
PlotSummary: The film deals with the life of Ragupathi (Siddharth Venugopal), whose mother died in childbirth. His father is the Deputy-Chief Dam (maintenance) Engineer in the Ambasamudiram dam, Tirunelveli, while Ragu is a mechanical engineer. He is frustrated because he is unemployed. One day, after returning after an Interview in Pune, when he meets Madhumitha (Tamannaah); a native character, she plays childish pranks and brings energy into his life. When he returns a month later, trouble had come in the form of Rad

Title: Nissash Amar Tumi
PlotSummary: Hridoy (Shakib Khan) is a rich, city boy, born to billionaire parents and brought up in London. On the other hand, Aasha (Apu Biswas)is a traditional, simple desi girl from Bangladesh who is brought up by her only brother, Mohammod Ali (Misha Sawdagor) He is heartbroken when their father marries another woman and throws them out of the house, humiliating them on the way. One day, Purnima (Aasha's best friend) comes to their house to invite Aasha to their home as she is getting married.

Title: Lost Medallion: The Adventures of Billy Stone, TheThe Lost Medallion: The Adventures of Billy Stone
PlotSummary: The movie begins as Daniel Anderson (Alex Kendrick) arrives at a foster home, bringing donations. He is asked to tell a story to the children and the movie transitions into the Lost Medallion universe. The movie flashes back to the present where Billy (Billy Unger) sneaks into his father's archaeology site and tries to help work. He and his best friend Allie (Sammi Hanratty) discover the medallion buried in a different spot than where his dad was looking. The pair are captured and taken to a nearby village, where the village king notices the medallist and claims it is his

Title: My Cousin Vinny
PlotSummary: Billy Gambini and Stan Rothenstein are college students from New York who shoplift a can of tuna. The store clerk is robbed and killed, and Billy and Stan are arrested for the murder. Billy's cousin Vinny is a personal injury lawyer from Brooklyn, newly admitted to the bar, and with no trial experience. Despite his missteps, Vinny shows that he is able to make up for his inexperience with an aggressive questioning style.

Title: Meerayude Dukhavum Muthuvinte Swapnavum
PlotSummary: Muthu and his younger sister Meera live with their grandmother and uncle Suseelan. He falls in love with Aswathy and meets a mysterious man named Siddan. Meera, who is crippled, is also a child who lives with her aunt and uncle.

Title: Grave Tales
PlotSummary: A young, genealogist (Heather Darcy) whiles away her afternoon in an eerie graveyard to identify graves. The local butcher (Frank Scantori) has a lethal confrontation with a vampire and decides to use his shop as a perfect way to dispose of the remains. After killing a junk shop owner (Edward de Souza) and stealing his antique mirror, a greedy man (Damien Thomas) discovers it reveals a portal to another world. A newly recruited member of an all-girl rock group is invited to do a video for their up-and-coming single.

Title: December-1
PlotSummary: Basupura is a tiny village where Madevappa works in a flour mill and his wife makes rotis and sells in nearby towns. The whole village is getting geared up for the Chief Minister (CM)'s visit on 1 December. CM's officially scheduled overnight stay in Madevpa's house gives him a higher status and a brighter future.

Title: Crack in the Mirror
PlotSummary: Eponine is accused of seeing a man named Larnier behind his back. The body of Hagolin is dismembered and dumped. The plot is set up by wealthy attorney Lamerciere's longtime mistress, Florence, and his young law partner, Claude. Claude, who is secretly Florence's lover, feels he deserves credit for much of his success.

Title: Dhanam
PlotSummary: The film opens with a cop searching for a prostitute named Dhanam in the streets of Hyderabad. The story goes five years back from the present day. Ananth (Prem), a young student from a Hindu Brahmin family based in Kumbakudam comes to Hyderabad to study medicine. He falls in love with her and begins to follow her for several days. She suspects that Ananth came to her to do business and takes him to her place. They both have sex for money and this begins to happen frequently. One day Ananth opens up his feelings to her, but she refuses his propose, let

Title: Sabse Bada Khiladi
PlotSummary: Lallu (Akshay Kumar) is an orphan who was separated from his parents and brother in his childhood and has been brought up by foster parents. He travels to Bombay to look for a job and starts working as a loyal servant for a rich businessman. When Jamna Das suddenly dies of a heart attack, his will and testament reveals that Sunita must get married to him or she will not be entitled to any of his wealth and estate. She marries him but decides to have him killed with the help of Amit so that she can inherit all of her father's wealth.

Title: Scream and Scream Again
PlotSummary: The movie's structure is fragmented, as it alternates between three distinguishable plot threads. The centerpiece of the movie is a nearly fifteen minutes long police - murder suspect car chase/foot-chase sequence. Vincent Price plays Dr Browning, whose clinic specializes in limb and organ transplantation. Christopher Lee plays Fremont, the head of Britain's (unnamed) intelligence services.

Title: Springfield Rifle
PlotSummary: Major Lex Kearney is drummed out of the Union Army with a dishonorable discharge. Wife Erin even informs him that their ashamed son has run away. What no one knows is that Kearney has accepted a fake discharge so he can carry out a top-secret assignment to go undercover and find the rustlers who have been providing horses to Confederate troops.

Title: The Arnelo Affair
PlotSummary: A lawyer's wife, Anne Parkson, is bored and neglected. She begins meeting with one of her husbands clients, a nightclub owner Tony Arnelo. Tony is in love with Anne and attempts to force her into leaving her husband. He commits "suicide by cop" attempting to escape the police.

Title: The World Owes Me a Living
PlotSummary: Air Commodore Paul Collyer (Farrar) appears to be suffering from amnesia. He is seen as part of a flying circus display at which Moira is a spectator. A serious accident to one of the planes brings them together. He meets old flame Eve Heatherley (Sonia Dresdel) who is now engaged to Paul's friend Jack Graves.

Title: What's the Worst That Could Happen?
PlotSummary: Kevin Caffrey is a thief and connoisseur who is at a local auction looking for things worth stealing. He meets Amber Belhaven who is auctioning off her father's painting to pay a hotel bill. Meanwhile, Kevin and Berger hire Shelly Nix, a computer hacker, to track Max Fairbanks' whereabouts by hacking into his e-mail. The next morning Max finds out that his house has been robbed and meets with Detective Alex Tardio of the Robbery Division. Max is banned from his summer house, and his being there breached the terms of his bankruptcy.

Title: EuroTrip
PlotSummary: Scott Thomas (Scott Mechlowicz) is dumped by his girlfriend, Fiona (Kristin Kreuk), immediately after his high school graduation. Scott has always misunderstood his pen pal's name as "Mike", thinking that she is male. Scott decides to travel to Europe, with his best friend, Cooper Harris, to find Mieke and apologize in person. Scott and Cooper arrive in London, where they befriend a Manchester United football hooligan firm, led by Vinnie Jones.

Title: The Temptress
PlotSummary: The story opens in Paris at a masquerade ball where the unhappy Elena (Garbo) meets Manuel Robledo (Antonio Moreno), an Argentine engineer. The next day when he goes to visit his friend, Marques De Torre Bianca (Armand Kaliz) Manuel is stunned to learn that his wife happens to be Elena. Wanting nothing more to do with her, he leaves.

Title: The Skeleton Key
PlotSummary: Caroline Ellis, a hospice aide, quits her position at a hospital and is hired as the caretaker of an isolated plantation house in Terrebonne Parish, Louisiana. The elderly lady of the house, Violet Devereaux, needs help looking after her husband Benjamin, who was mostly paralyzed by an apparent stroke. She discovers a secret room filled with Hoodoo paraphernalia in the attic. The house used to belong to two African American servants who were employed at the house 90 years before. The servants, Mama Cecile and Papa Justify, were renowned Hoodoo practitioners.

Title: Sun Sajna
PlotSummary: Basanti (Ranjeeta Kaur) lives in Madhupur with her father and uncle. She meets a singer named Raj Kumar (Mithun Chakraborty) at the hotel, "Tin Min" Raj Kumar falls in love with Basanti and she does with him also, but she does not show it. Raj and Basanti would often go on the hill and dream of their married life together. But before the marriage could take place, Raj has to perform his show in Bombay and bring his mother to meet Basanti. Raj's mother dies, Raj goes blind and his uncle is injured

Title: Cross Streets
PlotSummary: Adam Blythe is spurned by his fiancé, Ann Clement, at his college graduation. Adam becomes a small-town veterinarian, unable to practice medicine. Adam runs into an old schoolmate, Morton Talbot, who flunked out of college. Adam meets June Grattan, the 17-year-old daughter of Ann and Jerry, and she and Adam fall in love. Ann marries Jerry, who has followed Ann, and when he sees her with Adam, takes out a gun and fires at her. As he lays dying, he asks Jerry for the gun, which he wipes clean of fingerprints

Title: Barbershop
PlotSummary: Calvin Palmer Jr. (Ice Cube) has had enough of trying to keep open the barbershop his father handed down to him. He sells the shop to a loan shark, who secretly plans to turn it into a strip club. After spending a day at work, he rethinks his decision and tries to get the shop back - only to find out Wallace wants double the $20,000 he paid Calvin to return it.

Title: Theatre of Blood
PlotSummary: Shakespearean actor Edward Lionheart (Vincent Price) is seen committing suicide by diving into the Thames from a great height. Unbeknownst to the public, he survives and is rescued by a group of vagrants. Two years later, on 15 March, he sets out to exact vengeance against the critics who failed to acclaim his genius.

Title: Badhti Ka Naam Dadhi
PlotSummary: The premise of the film is that a multimillionaire, who has no heir, decides to leave his wealth to the person who has the longest beard. What follows is complete mayhem as Kishore Kumar and K. N. Singh plot to outwit one another.

Title: Dolls
PlotSummary: The film is not in strict chronological order, but there is a strong visual emphasis on the changing of the seasons and the bonds of love over the progression of time. The film leads into it by opening with a performance of Bunraku theatre, and closes with a shot of dolls from the same.

Title: The Unsinkable Molly Brown
PlotSummary: Molly Brown is rescued from the Colorado River as an infant and raised by Seamus Tobin. She and miner Johnny Brown wed, and he sells his claim in a silver mine for $300,000. Soon after the money Molly hid in the stove is accidentally burnt, Johnny discovers the richest gold vein in state history. Molly sets out to improve her social status by trying to ingratiate herself with the city's elite, all of whom snub her and her nouveau riche ways.

Title: Battle of the Brave (Nouvelle-France)
PlotSummary: Trapper Francois returns to his hometown to visit his father. His father has just died and Francois is clueless in regards to the business he just inherited. Francois soon develops a crush on Marie-Loup, the town's healer. He is delighted when he sees her protecting an Indian girl against a racist. Both share a deep sympathy for the local tribe and speak its language fluently.

Title: The Four Musketeers
PlotSummary: Musketeers rescue Constance Bonancieux from imprisonment in Rochefort's abode of Saint Cloud. Milady de Winter seduces junior musketeer d'Artagnan to keep him occupied during Anglo-French War (1627–29) De Winter sends poisoned wine and a note intended to trick him into thinking that the trio have been imprisoned for drunkenness. Athos, Porthos, and Aramis rescue her and take her to safety in convent of Armentieres.

Title: The Demon
PlotSummary: A man, his mistress and his wife involve three children in their own games-with tragic results. After Sōkichi stops providing his mistress with monetary support, she leaves her three children with him, whom she insists are also his, and disappears. The three children are involved in a series of jealous relationships.

Title: Daniel Boone
PlotSummary: Boone's cabin is attacked by the Indians, who set it on fire and abduct Boone's daughter. Boone returns, swears vengeance, then heads out on the trail to the Indian camp. The Indians encounter Boone, which sets off a huge fight on the edge of a cliff. Boone is rescued by his horse, and Boone kills the Indian chief.

Title: Knife Edge
PlotSummary: A successful Wall Street trader returns to Britain with her family, but her new home in the countryside contains a disturbing secret. Her understanding of this secret is complicated by her husbands' difficulties and losing his job. In trying to hide this, he uses gaslighting to trick her into believing she is going insane.

Title: Stage to Thunder Rock
PlotSummary: In his last act before retirement, Horne tracks down the Sawyer brothers, who have robbed a bank of $50,000. Ross Sawyer, a wanted outlaw and father of the boys, intends to intercept the stagecoach before Horne can bring his son Reese to justice. The Parkers are in dire need of money and hope Leah can help them, although her reputation as a lady is in question.

Title: Wu Kong
PlotSummary: Set 500 years before the Monkey King wreaks havoc in the heavenly kingdom, it tells the stories of Wukong who, unwilling to bow down to his own destiny, sets out to rebel against the gods. Wukong is the story of a young man who is determined to defy his own fate.

Title: Hitchcock
PlotSummary: Alfred Hitchcock directed six more films after Psycho, none of which would eclipse the film's commercial success. The American Film Institute awarded Hitchcock its Life Achievement Award in 1979. Hitchcock's final film, North by Northwest, was released to theaters in 1959. The film was based on the real-life crimes of murderer Ed Gein.

Title: Angels Over Broadway
PlotSummary: Bill O'Brien is a New York con man in search of a suitable gullible person to make money on. In a nightclub he finds Charles Engle, a man ridden by guilt and on the brink of committing suicide after embezzling a large sum of money. One of the showgirls at the club, Nina Barona, is persuaded by Bill to help trick Charles into entering a poker game to win back the money. The game is arranged by a gangster named Dutch Enright.

Title: Circus World
PlotSummary: Matt Masters (John Wayne) bought a bankrupt circus in 1885 and successfully rebuilt it into a combination three ring and Wild West extravaganza. Masters wants to find the lost great love of his life, Lili Alfredo (Rita Hayworth), and figures that this tour will smoke her out if for no other reason than to see her child, Toni Alfredo. Masters buys a freighter, renames her the Circus Maximus, and the show sails for Europe. At Barcelona, the first port of call, the circus capsizes at the pier and puts the show in the toilet.

Title: Army Girl
PlotSummary: Capt. Dike Conger and M/Sgt. "Three Star" Hennessy are sent with their new light tank for tests against horse cavalry under desert conditions. During this period the Colonel's daughter Julie masquerades as a Southern Belle with no connection with the army to date Dike who vows to have nothing to do with Army Girls; the daughters of officers or soldiers.

Title: Licensed to Love and Kill
PlotSummary: Secret Agent Charles Bind is called in to investigate the disappearance of Lord Dangerfield, a British diplomat. The trail leads Bind to Dangefield’s daughter Carlotta Muff-Dangerfield, an ambitious American Senator named Lucifer Orchid. Bind is Bind's counterpart in the forces of evil, Ultra One.

Title: Crooks Anonymous
PlotSummary: Captain "Dandy Forsdyke" (Leslie Phillips) is a habitual criminal who can't resist a tempting robbery. He is engaged to Babette, a stripper who wants him to go straight before they marry. Babette comes across a society known as Crooks Anonymous who help hardened thieves go straight. They begin by locking him in a room filled with safes, which contain cigarettes, food, drink and booby traps.

Title: Saguni
PlotSummary: The film starts with the demise of CM (Satyamoorthy), a political plot produced by Boopathi (Prakash Raj), thereby starting the film on a serious note. We are introduced to Kamalakannan (Karthi), who tells his story to the auto driver Rajini Appadurai (Santhanam)

Title: Aisa Pyaar Kahan
PlotSummary: Sagar (Jeetendra) and Pooja (Padmini Kolhapure) are brother and sister who are and very affectionate to each other. Suraj (Mithun Chakraborty) saves Pooja from an accident and they fall in love. Sagar writes his entire property in the name of Pooja and goes on tour. He returns after finding out that his real peace of mind is with his sister.

Title: The Electric House
PlotSummary: Keaton plays a botany student who is accidentally awarded an electrical engineering degree. He then attempts to wire a home using many gadgets to cause mayhem. The man to whom the degree should have been awarded then exacts revenge by rewiring those gadgets to create mayhem.

Title: Seven Days to Noon
PlotSummary: Professor Willingdon (Barry Jones) works at Britain's atomic weapons development facility, the (fictitious) Wallingford Research Centre, from which he has surreptitiously taken a nuclear warhead. He threatens to destroy the centre of London in a week's time, at noon (hence the film title), unless the British government declares that it is to stop all stockpiling of nuclear warheads. Detective Superintendent Folland of Scotland Yard's Special Branch is charged with tracking down Willingden and stopping him. Willingon's assistant Lane (Hugh Cross) is recruited to help and they

Title: The Pittsburgh Kid
PlotSummary: Billy Conn is upset by the death of Pop Mallory, his manager. A boxing promoter, Max Allison, uses daughter Barbara to try to sway him away from Pop's daughter Pat Mallory. Meanwhile, nightclub owner Joe Barton resents the interest his girl Barbara Ellison has been showing Billy.

Title: Viva Villa!
